original: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /üîΩrnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste / rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, karma that has reached the time of its result is called ‚Äúmatured‚Äù because it has matured.üîΩThose that arise from that are called ‚Äúarisen from the matured seed.‚Äù

original: de las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub par gzung ba yin no //
translated: This is an example of establishing the meaning of an action.üîΩSince the result is only the matured result, it is called ‚Äúmatured.‚Äù This is an example of establishing the meaning of a substance.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin par brjod par 'dod na ni ngo bo sgrub pa kho nar yongs su gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin par brjod par 'dod na ni ngo bo sgrub pa kho nar yongs su gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is asserted that the result is the matured result, then it is established as a substance alone.

original: de lta bas na mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba yang bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba yang bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas te /
translated: Therefore the eye is arisen from the matured seed.üîΩThis is an example of establishing the meaning of an action.

original: ngo bo sgrub par smin pa'i sgo nas kyang grub la las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba yang ngo sgrub pa smos pa'i sgo nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo sgrub par smin pa'i sgo nas kyang grub la las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba yang ngo sgrub pa smos pa'i sgo nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: It is also established by the door of maturation as a substance alone, since it is said that karma is the matured result.

original: sgras rtogs pa ni brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgras rtogs pa ni brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the understanding of sound is preceded by the desire to speak.

original: mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes /
translated: The ripening of dissimilar type is karmic maturation.

original: bya ba ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe result of dissimilar type‚Äù means the result that is dissimilar from its cause.

original: rgyu ni lung du bstan pa kho na yin la 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni lung du bstan pa kho na yin la 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: The cause is only neutral, but the result is only non-neutral.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa'i smin pa ni 'dra ba kho na yin pas khyad par du byas pa yin ni //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa'i smin pa ni 'dra ba kho na yin pas khyad par du byas pa yin ni //
translated: The ripening of coemergent causes and so on is similar type alone.

original: bstan @199b bcos chos mngon pa las 'di skad du rnam par 'chad pas de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: bstan @199b bcos chos mngon pa las 'di skad du rnam par 'chad pas de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma treatise, which explains:

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'god par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'god par byed de /
translated: Therefore it is stated: ‚ÄúThe cause of karmic maturation is one aggregate and so on.‚Äù

original: 'di la thob pa dag ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun bzhin du sems pa la sogs pa las tha dad par gnas pas de dag gi 'bras bu yang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pa'i tshul du logs shig tu brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la thob pa dag ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun bzhin du sems pa la sogs pa las tha dad par gnas pas de dag gi 'bras bu yang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pa'i tshul du logs shig tu brjod do //
translated: Since obtainment exists separately from such things as the mind, like the outer bark of a tree, it is stated separately as the cause that fully produces their results.

original: 'di la phung po gcig yod pas na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la phung po gcig yod pas na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa ste /
translated: It is the cause of a single aggregate because it is the cause of a single aggregate.

original: phung po gang la thob pa dag yod pa de nyid de la de dag gis skye ba la sogs pa yang yod pas phung po gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po gang la thob pa dag yod pa de nyid de la de dag gis skye ba la sogs pa yang yod pas phung po gcig pa yin no //
translated: Since it exists in the aggregate in which obtainment exists, it is the cause of a single aggregate because it exists in the aggregate in which obtainment exists.

original: thob pa dag gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i yang yin pas 'bras bu thun mong ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yin no //
analyzed: thob pa dag gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i yang yin pas 'bras bu thun mong ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yin no //
translated: Since the result of obtainment is the result of such things as arising, it is the cause of a single result because it has a common result.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gnyis la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni lus dang ngag gi las dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa ste lus dang ngag gi las dag ni gzugs kyi phung por bsdus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gnyis la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni lus dang ngag gi las dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa ste lus dang ngag gi las dag ni gzugs kyi phung por bsdus pa'i phyir la /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is two aggregates with one effect, such as physical and verbal karma and their arising and so on, because physical and verbal karma are subsumed by the form aggregate and

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gnyis yin no //
translated: their arising and so on are subsumed by the formation aggregate.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yang yin no //
translated: They are also one effect because their effect is undifferentiated.üîΩThe cause of natural outflow is four aggregates with one effect, such as virtuous minds and mental factors arising with their concomitant states of arising and so on.

original: phung po gzhi la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dag ste sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni ci rigs par tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du
analyzed: phung po gzhi la 'bras bu gcig pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dag ste sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni ci rigs par tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du
translated: Those minds and mental factors are subsumed by the aggregates of feeling, discernment, formation and consciousness.

original: byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung pas bsdus pa'i phyir la skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po bzhi yin no //
analyzed: byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung pas bsdus pa'i phyir la skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po bzhi yin no //
translated: because they are included in the aggregates of form, sensation, ideation, and formations, and because birth, etc., are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: 'bras bu thun mong ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thun mong ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yin te /
translated: They have the same effect, because their effect is common.

original: sems kyang 'bras bu yang gzhan la sems las byung ba rnams kyi yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyang 'bras bu yang gzhan la sems las byung ba rnams kyi yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors do not have a different effect.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po lnga la 'bras bu gcig pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po lnga la 'bras bu gcig pa ni med do //
translated: In the realm of desire, there is no effect of the same type for the five aggregates of the cause of retribution, because there is no concentration.üîΩIn the realm of form, the aggregate of form is not of the same effect as the mind and mental factors, because the effect of the aggregate of form is the body and voice,

original: 'di na gzugs kyi phung pos sdug bsngal lus dang ngag gi las ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag dang 'bras bu gcig par @200a * //üîΩmi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na gzugs kyi phung pos sdug bsngal lus dang ngag gi las ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag dang 'bras bu gcig par @200a * // mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the effect of the mind and mental factors is not the body and voice.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not of the same effect, because their collections are different.

original: phung po gsum pa can ni khams gsum char na yang med de /
analyzed: phung po gsum pa can ni khams gsum char na yang med de /
translated: In the three realms, there is no effect of the same type for the three aggregates, because the aggregate of form is not included in the three aggregates.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir dang / ci rigs par phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir dang / ci rigs par phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because minds and mental factors necessarily have the same result and because they are the intrinsic state of four aggregates, as appropriate.üîΩIn the form realm, the cause of karmic maturation is one aggregate,

original: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin no //
translated: because that which is obtained together with arising and so on is subsumed by the aggregate of formation.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu thun mong pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu thun mong pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can yang yin no //
translated: Similarly, they are one result because they have a common result.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment should be described in the same way.

original: rnam par rig byed ni gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir la skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir la skye ba la sogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Because indicative form is subsumed by form and because arising and so on are the intrinsic state of the aggregate of formation, they are two aggregates.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa can ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa can ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The result is the same as before.

original: dge ba'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa la ni rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pas gzugs kyi phung po ma gtogs pa tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa la ni rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pas gzugs kyi phung po ma gtogs pa tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po bzhi pa yin no //
translated: In a virtuous mind that is not concentrated, there is no form that is concomitant with the mind, so it is included in the four aggregates of feeling and so on, excluding the form aggregate.

original: phung po lnga pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa na ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa na ste /
translated: The five aggregates are in a concentrated mind.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs ni sems la sogs pa dang gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs ni sems la sogs pa dang gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Concomitant form arises simultaneously with the mind and so on.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is one result that is a single aggregate and four aggregates.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de na gzugs thams cad med pa nyid pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa dang phung po bzhi pa yin te /üîΩde la thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni phung po gcig yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de na gzugs thams cad med pa nyid pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa dang phung po bzhi pa yin te / de la thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni phung po gcig yin te /
translated: There, since all form does not exist, the single aggregate is the result of the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩThe four aggregates are the result of the cause of natural outflow.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The single aggregate is the obtainment of that and so on, as before.üîΩThe four aggregates are feeling and so on.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig pa yin no //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation and that which is associated with its arising, etc.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the same effect‚Äù is easy to understand.üîΩKarma also exists that has a single homogeneous cause and a single effect.üîΩThe life faculty is the effect of a single homogeneous cause, because it is the effect of a single homogeneous cause that is a single life faculty.

original: las kyang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa ni srog gi dbang po yin pa las de'i rnam par smin pa ni gdon mi za bar srog gi dbang po de dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa maüîΩyin pa @200b rnams yin la /üîΩde thams cad kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa ni srog gi dbang po yin pa las de'i rnam par smin pa ni gdon mi za bar srog gi dbang po de dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa @200b rnams yin la / de thams cad kyang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising, etc. of that life faculty are its effect, because they are necessarily concomitant with that life faculty.üîΩSince all of these are included in the phenomena element, the effect of a single sense base ripens.

original: gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te /
translated: If the mental faculty is the effect of a single homogeneous cause, then two sense bases are the effect of a single homogeneous cause.

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag go zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched de'i tshogs pa la ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba la sogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba rnam par smin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag go zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched de'i tshogs pa la ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba la sogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba rnam par smin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
translated: The mental faculty and the phenomena element are its two bases.üîΩThe mental faculty base is definitely concomitant with feeling and so on and arising and so forth that are its coemergent results.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa yid dang chos kyi skye mched dang de gnyis rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa yid dang chos kyi skye mched dang de gnyis rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since feeling and so on and arising and so on are subsumed by the phenomena element, the mental faculty and phenomena element are its maturational results.üîΩThe same applies to the tactile base.

original: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i skye mched de la gdon mi za bar skye ba la sogs pa yang yod pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi reg bya'i skye mched 'ba'
analyzed: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i skye mched de la gdon mi za bar skye ba la sogs pa yang yod pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi reg bya'i skye mched 'ba'
translated: The tactile base is definitely concomitant with arising and so on. Since the phenomena element is also its maturational result, the tactile base is also subsumed by the phenomena element.

original: zhig pa ni ma yin pas de'i skye mched gnyis rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhig pa ni ma yin pas de'i skye mched gnyis rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore its two bases are its maturational results.

original: gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum ste lus kyi skye mched de nyid dang de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir de'i rten reg bya'i skye mched 'byung ba bzhi tshan dad de'i skye ba la sogs pa yang
analyzed: gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum ste lus kyi skye mched de nyid dang de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir de'i rten reg bya'i skye mched 'byung ba bzhi tshan dad de'i skye ba la sogs pa yang
translated: Those who possess the body sense base possess three because they definitely possess the body sense base and the four great elements that are its support and the tactile objects that are its support are also its arising and so on.

original: yod pas de la gsum pa chos kyi skye mched kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pas de la gsum pa chos kyi skye mched kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the phenomena element is its karmic maturation.

original: de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du skye mched gsum po yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa gzugs dang dri dang ro'i skye mched rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa yang de bzhin du skye mched gsum po yin te /
translated: Those who possess the karmic maturation of any of the form, smell and taste sense bases also possess three sense bases.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i skye mched de nyid dang de'i rten 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid reg bya'i skye mched dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i skye mched de nyid dang de'i rten 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid reg bya'i skye mched dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The sense base of form and so on is the sense base of form and so forth, the sense base of tactility is the sense base of the essential nature of the elements that are its support, and the sense base of mental objects is the sense base of the essential nature of its arising and so on.

original: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de ni bzhi ste /üîΩmig de nyid dang mig kyang gdon mi za bar lus la rag lus te /
analyzed: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de ni bzhi ste / mig de nyid dang mig kyang gdon mi za bar lus la rag lus te /
translated: One who possesses the eye sense base possesses four sense bases.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir lus kyi skye mched dang snga ma bzhin du reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched dag go //üîΩgang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa rna ba @201a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir lus kyi skye mched dang snga ma bzhin du reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched dag go // gang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi rnam par smin pa rna ba @201a * //
translated: The eye sense base itself, the body sense base, since the eye definitely depends on the body, the tactility sense base, and the mental object sense base, as before.üîΩOne who possesses the ear, nose, and tongue sense bases possesses four sense bases in the same way.

original: la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa yang de dang 'dra bar skye mched bzhi yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa de'i rnam par smin pa yang de dang 'dra bar skye mched bzhi yin te /
translated: One who possesses any of the ear, nose, and tongue sense bases possesses four sense bases, since the ear sense base itself, the body sense base, the tactility sense base, and the mental object sense base are definitely possessed.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i skye mched de nyid dang snga ma bzhin du lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i skye mched de nyid dang snga ma bzhin du lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched dag go //
translated: The sense base of form and so on, or whatever is suitable, is the same as before, and the body sense base, the tactility sense base, and the entity sense base are also the same as before.

original: las de yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skye mched lnga nas bcu gcig gi bar zhes ci rigs par sbyar ro //üîΩrnam par smin pa skye mched bcu gnyis pa ni med de /
analyzed: las de yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skye mched lnga nas bcu gcig gi bar zhes ci rigs par sbyar ro // rnam par smin pa skye mched bcu gnyis pa ni med de /
translated: Karma also exists that is the cause of five sense bases up to eleven sense bases.

original: sgra'i skye mched rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i skye mched rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no karma that is the cause of twelve sense bases because the sense base of sound is not a ripened result.

original: 'di la slob dpon dbyig bshes na re gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon dbyig bshes na re gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Master P≈´r·πáavardhana says that it is untenable to state, Karma also exists that is the cause of one sense base, the entity sense base.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the faculty of life force is the result of projecting karma.

original: re zhig gal te 'dod pa'i khams na las kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur na gdon mi za bar skye mched drug ma dod pa nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni lus dang srog gi dbang po dag yod do //
analyzed: re zhig gal te 'dod pa'i khams na las kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur na gdon mi za bar skye mched drug ma dod pa nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni lus dang srog gi dbang po dag yod do //
translated: If action ripens in the realm of desire, then, without doubt, in the embryonic states of kalala, etc., the organs of body and of life are present, for the six sense-faculties are not absent there.

original: skye mched drug don nas ni mig la sogs pa drug dang yid kyi skye mched bdun yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug don nas ni mig la sogs pa drug dang yid kyi skye mched bdun yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the moment when the six sense-faculties are present, there are seven sense-faculties, including the mental faculty.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang bdun to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang bdun to //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are also seven sense-faculties.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gdon mi za bar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gdon mi za bar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In the realm of immateriality, there are also two sense-faculties, the mental faculty and the sense-faculty of factors.

original: srog gi dbang po ni skye ba thams cad 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni skye ba thams cad 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense-faculty of life is the effect of the action which projects the existence.

original: yang na 'dir khams gang las bsams zhes smras so //
analyzed: yang na 'dir khams gang las bsams zhes smras so //
translated: Or else, in this verse, what realm is referred to?

original: gzugs med pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The realm of immateriality.

original: de na yang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar yid kyi skye mched kyang yod par 'gyur la rnam par smin pa ni tshor bas rab tu phye pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa srog gi dbangüîΩpo kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin pas de ni tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de na yang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar yid kyi skye mched kyang yod par 'gyur la rnam par smin pa ni tshor bas rab tu phye pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa srog gi dbang po kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin pas de ni tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Also, since the faculty of life force is the result of projecting karma, the mental base would definitely exist there.

original: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: Since karmic maturation is distinguished by feeling, it is not the case that the faculty of life force alone is karmic maturation. Therefore feeling and so on would also exist there.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'di ni skad cig ma skye ba las bsams nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig ma skye ba las bsams nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained from the perspective of momentary birth.

original: skad cig ma gang la gzugs @201b med par skyes pa'i sems rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i skad cig ma de la rnam par smin pa srog gi dbang po kho na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / yid kyi skye mched ni kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin par srog gi dbang po kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur na ci'i phyir de kun du 'byung ba'i tshe gzhan yid kyi skye mched kyang yod pas de'i rnam par smin pa yid dang chos
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la gzugs @201b med par skyes pa'i sems rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i skad cig ma de la rnam par smin pa srog gi dbang po kho na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / yid kyi skye mched ni kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin par srog gi dbang po kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur na ci'i phyir de kun du 'byung ba'i tshe gzhan yid kyi skye mched kyang yod pas de'i rnam par smin pa yid dang chos
translated: Because when the mind of one born in the formless realm does not arise from karmic maturation, only the karmic maturation of the faculty of life force exists at that moment.

original: kyi skye mched gnyis yin zhes rnam par 'chad par byed /
analyzed: kyi skye mched gnyis yin zhes rnam par 'chad par byed /
translated: Since the karmic maturation of the faculty of life force alone exists at that moment, why does the Abhidharmakosa explain that when it arises, the karmic maturation of the faculty of life force is both the mental base and the phenomena base?

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yin na srog gi dbang po rnam par smin pa'i tshe yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yin na srog gi dbang po rnam par smin pa'i tshe yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the faculty of life force is karmic maturation, the mental faculty and so on are also karmic maturation.

original: skye mched gzhan rnam par smin pa yin pa ni mi 'gog go //
analyzed: skye mched gzhan rnam par smin pa yin pa ni mi 'gog go //
translated: But it does not deny that other faculties are karmic maturation.

original: 'dir ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bsam pa yin te gang gi chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi skye mched gzhan ni ma yin pa'i las de yang yod de zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod par zad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bsam pa yin te gang gi chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi skye mched gzhan ni ma yin pa'i las de yang yod de zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod par zad do //
translated: Here the cause of karmic maturation is being considered, and the mere statement that there is karma that is the karmic maturation of one element alone, the phenomena element, and not of other elements is what is intended.

original: srog gi dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i las nyid la yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi skye mched gcig kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i las nyid la yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi skye mched gcig kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the faculty of life force is the karmic maturation of projecting karma, then the mental faculty and so on are also karmic maturation and not just one faculty alone.

original: 'di la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la smra bar bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: de la yid la sogs pa gzhan dag yod pa yang las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin gyi las gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di cis byas /
analyzed: de la yid la sogs pa gzhan dag yod pa yang las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin gyi las gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di cis byas /
translated: What is the reason for this certainty?

original: ris mthun pa yang las gcig gi rnam par smin pa yin la /
analyzed: ris mthun pa yang las gcig gi rnam par smin pa yin la /
translated: It is possible that the homogeneous collection of elements is the karmic maturation of one karma,

original: srog gi dbang po yang gzhan gyi yin /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po yang gzhan gyi yin /
translated: but the faculty of life force is the karmic maturation of another karma,

original: yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang gzhan kho na'i yin no zhes bya ba'i srid pa gang yin pa ni yod do //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang gzhan kho na'i yin no zhes bya ba'i srid pa gang yin pa ni yod do //
translated: and the mental faculty and so on are the karmic maturation of another karma.üîΩIf you say that the eye sense faculty is the karmic maturation of karma to be experienced in a third life, then the other sense faculties would also be the karmic maturation of karma to be experienced in a third life, because the Abhidharmako≈õa declares,

original: gal te khyod ji ltar gang gis mig gi skye mched yin pa de ni mig dang lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so zhes bya ba'i skabs su gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gdon mi za ba
analyzed: gal te khyod ji ltar gang gis mig gi skye mched yin pa de ni mig dang lus dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so zhes bya ba'i skabs su gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gdon mi za ba
translated: That which is the karmic maturation of the eye sense faculty is the karmic maturation of the ear, nose, tongue, and body sense faculties.

original: yin pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched kyang yin pa de bzhin du yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched kyang yin pa de bzhin du yid kyi skye mched la sogs pa yang las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: Just as the body sense base is the karmic maturation of that action, so too the mental faculty and so on are the karmic maturation of that action.

original: @202a * // de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @202a * // de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'ga' zhig kho na la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'ga' zhig kho na la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because some arise in dependence on some other.

original: mig gi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po med par 'byung ba med kyi srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa'i yid med kyang 'byung ba yod pas 'di ni mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po med par 'byung ba med kyi srog gi dbang po ni rnam par smin pa'i yid med kyang 'byung ba yod pas 'di ni mi mtshungs so //
translated: The eye sense faculty does not arise without the body sense faculty, but the life faculty does arise without the maturational mental faculty.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i las kyang yod de /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: There is karma that matures as the phenomena element alone.

original: gang gi srog gi dbang po yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi srog gi dbang po yin pa'o //
translated: That is the life faculty.

original: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni lnga ste /
analyzed: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni lnga ste /
translated: That which is the eye sense faculty is fivefold.

original: mig dang lus dang gzugs dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang lus dang gzugs dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: The eye, body, form, tactility, and phenomena sense bases.

original: lce'i skye mched kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩgang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: lce'i skye mched kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o // gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi ste /
translated: The same applies up to the sense-source of the tongue.

original: lus dang gzugs dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so zhes zer te /
analyzed: lus dang gzugs dang reg bya dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so zhes zer te /
translated: Those who have the sense-source of the body have four sense-sources: the sense-sources of body, visible form, sound and the mental object.üîΩThe sense-source of visible form is the ripened effect of the action that engenders the eye sense-faculty, for it does not occur when there is no visible form.üîΩThis is the opinion of another school.

original: gzugs med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kyang mig sgrub par byed pa'i las de nyid kyi rnam par smin pa yin no zhes gzhung lugs gzhan zhig 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kyang mig sgrub par byed pa'i las de nyid kyi rnam par smin pa yin no zhes gzhung lugs gzhan zhig 'dod par byed do //
translated: The Master [Vasubandhu] does not accept that the sense-source of visible form is necessarily the ripened effect of the action that engenders the eye sense-faculty.

original: slob dpon 'di ni gzugs kyi skye mched las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin par nges pa med do zhes bya ba phyogs gzhan gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum mo //
analyzed: slob dpon 'di ni gzugs kyi skye mched las de kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin par nges pa med do zhes bya ba phyogs gzhan gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gsum mo //
translated: He follows the opinion of the other school, namely, that those who have the sense-source of the body have three sense-sources: the sense-sources of body, sound and the mental object.

original: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: gang gi mig gi skye mched yin pa de'i ni bzhi'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: Those who have the sense-source of the eye have four sense-sources: the sense-sources of the eye, body, sound and the mental object.

original: srog gi dbang po dang ris mthun pa la sogs pa phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba rnams gdon mi za bar las gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang ris mthun pa la sogs pa phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba rnams gdon mi za bar las gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: and the faculties of life force and those of similar type are not necessarily the karmic maturation of a single action.

original: rnam par bshad pa byed pa rnams kyis phyogs de gnyis bris pa la de dag gang zhig gang la dad pa de des yongs su bzung bar zad de /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa byed pa rnams kyis phyogs de gnyis bris pa la de dag gang zhig gang la dad pa de des yongs su bzung bar zad de /
translated: The two positions have been written down by the Vaibhasikas, but whichever one is believed, that is what is accepted.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: yang ji ltar na las kha cig gi rnam par smin pa ni skye mched gcig rnam par smin par gyur pa nas kha cig gi ni bcu gcig gi bar yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na las kha cig gi rnam par smin pa ni skye mched gcig rnam par smin par gyur pa nas kha cig gi ni bcu gcig gi bar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the karmic maturation of some actions is the karmic maturation of one sense base, up to the karmic maturation of eleven?

original: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, because the result of karma is various and not various.

original: padma dang bal po se'u dang shing n+ya gro dha la /
analyzed: padma dang bal po se'u dang shing n+ya gro dha la /
translated: In a lotus, mango, and banyan tree,

original: @202b sogs pa dag gi sa bon te padma la sogs pa'i sa bon ni 'bras bu rtsa ba dang myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang ze ba dang ze 'bru dang snying po sna tshogs pa yin la //
analyzed: @202b sogs pa dag gi sa bon te padma la sogs pa'i sa bon ni 'bras bu rtsa ba dang myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang ze ba dang ze 'bru dang snying po sna tshogs pa yin la //
translated: The seeds of lotus and so on have various fruits, such as roots, sprouts, stems, leaves, filaments, pericarps, and pistils.

original: shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa yang yal ga'i mdo dang yal ga dang 'dab ma dang mgo lcog dang myu gu dang me tog dang 'bras bu du ma phun sum tshogs pa sprin lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa yang yal ga'i mdo dang yal ga dang 'dab ma dang mgo lcog dang myu gu dang me tog dang 'bras bu du ma phun sum tshogs pa sprin lta bur snang ngo //
translated: The seeds of banyan and so on have many branches, twigs, leaves, tops, sprouts, flowers, and fruits, appearing like clouds.

original: kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bras bu sna tshogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some seeds do not have various fruits,

original: 'di lta ste nas dang gro la sogs pa'i sa bon dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nas dang gro la sogs pa'i sa bon dag lta bu'o //
translated: such as the seeds of barley, wheat, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir te 'di ni sa bon gyi chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir te 'di ni sa bon gyi chos nyid yin no //
translated: Because the fruits have the same nature. This is the nature of seeds.

original: las dus gcig pa'i ste 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum pa ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnam par smin par ni 'gyur gyi las dus gnyis pa yang ste 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i yang dus gcig pa ste
analyzed: las dus gcig pa'i ste 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum pa ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnam par smin par ni 'gyur gyi las dus gnyis pa yang ste 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i yang dus gcig pa ste
translated: The karmic maturation of a past action that occurred in the past ripens in the three times, but the karmic maturation of a present action that occurs in the present does not ripen in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The opposite is not so.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni las skad cig ma mang po'i skad cig ma gcig pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni las skad cig ma mang po'i skad cig ma gcig pa ste /
translated: The opposite is not so means that the karmic maturation of many moments of action does not occur in a single moment.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩrnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is because the result would be too small in relation to the cause.üîΩKarmic maturation does not ripen simultaneously with the action because coemergent states are not karmic maturation because coemergent states are homogeneous and concomitant causes that perform their function.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed pa'i phyir la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed pa'i phyir la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Karmic maturation is not coemergent because karmic maturation is dependent on dissimilar states.

original: rnam par smin pa mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the subsequent state of karmic maturation, because it is projected by the power of the immediately preceding condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis drangs pa yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin yang /
analyzed: mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis drangs pa yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin yang /
translated: The subsequent moment is drawn out by the power of the immediately preceding condition.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis drangs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te /üîΩ'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma res 'ga' ni dge ba res 'ga' ni mi dge ba res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan @203a * //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis drangs pa ni ma yin no // 'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te / 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma res 'ga' ni dge ba res 'ga' ni mi dge ba res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan @203a * //
translated: Thus, the subsequent moment is drawn out by the power of the immediately preceding condition, but it is not drawn out by the power of the cause of karmic maturation.

original: par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is exactly the case, because the immediately preceding condition sometimes produces a virtuous subsequent moment, sometimes an unvirtuous moment, and sometimes an undefined moment from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: de lta ma yin no lung du ma bstan pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no lung du ma bstan pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be undefined alone.

original: rnam pa gcig tu mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu mjug thogs kyi skad cig ma rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, in another way, the subsequent moment is not the nature of the result of karmic maturation because it is drawn out by the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of the result of karmic maturation because it is not drawn out by the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ma drangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ma drangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu smin pa ni rgyun la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun yod na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pas rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu smin pa ni rgyun la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun yod na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pas rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: The result of karmic maturation ripens in dependence on a continuum means that if the continuum of mind and mental factors exists, the result of karmic maturation is produced by the past cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of things.üîΩThe time of these has been explained by implication.

original: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyis bshad kyi rang gi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyis bshad kyi rang gi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The time of these has been explained by implication, but not by their own terms.

original: brjod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of expression:

original: rang gi sgras bstan pa dang / don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sgras bstan pa dang / don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: expression by means of the term itself and expression by means of the meaning.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: Homogeneous cause is similar.

original: rang ris sa pa'o sngar skyes rnams //
analyzed: rang ris sa pa'o sngar skyes rnams //
translated: Those previously arisen are of its type and level.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
translated: The omnipresent is said to be afflicted.

original: rnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga //
analyzed: rnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga //
translated: The five omnipresent ones are omnipresent in their own level.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na yod kyi ma 'ongs pa dag ni med do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na yod kyi ma 'ongs pa dag ni med do //
translated: Thus homogeneous cause and omnipresent cause exist in the past and present alone, but not in the future.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni khyad par ma smos pa nyid kyi phyir don gyis na dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni khyad par ma smos pa nyid kyi phyir don gyis na dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no /
translated: Coemergent cause, concomitant cause and the cause of karmic maturation are explained to exist in the three times by implication because they are not specified.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho na sngar skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho na sngar skyes pa yin la /
translated: Homogeneous cause and omnipresent cause are only previously arisen.

original: sngar skyes pa kho na yang de dag yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun du 'bras bu nyid yin par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems la sogs pa dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di rnams dus su ma gtogs pa nyid bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa kho na yang de dag yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun du 'bras bu nyid yin par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems la sogs pa dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di rnams dus su ma gtogs pa nyid bzlog pa yin no //
translated: and because it is ascertained that only those previously arisen are homogeneous causes, and because they are said to be reciprocal results, and because they are the nature of mind and so on and nonvirtue and so forth, they are excluded from the time period.

original: mdor bya ste zhes bya ba ni bsdus te /
analyzed: mdor bya ste zhes bya ba ni bsdus te /
translated: The term ‚Äúin brief‚Äù means ‚Äúin summary.‚Äù

original: mdor bya ba 'am mdor ma byas pa mdor bya ba yin no /
analyzed: mdor bya ba 'am mdor ma byas pa mdor bya ba yin no /
translated: Or it means ‚Äúin brief‚Äù because it is not elaborated.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ji ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ji ltar bshad ce na /
translated: Here the reason is ‚Äúbecause it has already been explained.‚Äù How has it been explained?

original: @203b skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na /üîΩde yang ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @203b skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na / de yang ma 'ongs pa la rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If a homogeneous cause possesses a result that is a natural outflow,üîΩthen it is illogical that future states are homogeneous causes.

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Because there is no earlier or later.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa de ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i ngo bo yin par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa de ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i ngo bo yin par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The reason for the homogeneous cause should be understood as the reason for the omnipresent cause.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang 'dra ste /
translated: The omnipresent cause is similar to the homogeneous cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the cause of afflicted entities.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa can kho na yin la /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa can kho na yin la /
translated: The omnipresent cause is also the cause of afflicted entities.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spyi'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par bzhag go zhes de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spyi'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par bzhag go zhes de ni bshad zin to //
translated: This is established as a separate cause from the homogeneous cause because it is the general cause of afflicted entities.

original: 'di ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang med la rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yang yin pas 'di'i tshul ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang med la rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yang yin pas 'di'i tshul ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is similar to the principle of the homogeneous cause alone, which does not exist in the future, but is endowed with a result in the form of a natural outflow.

original: gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum pa kho na gsum yin la /
analyzed: gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum pa kho na gsum yin la /
translated: The three are called ‚Äúof the three times‚Äù because they are only of the three times.

original: gsum kho na yang dus gsum pa yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum kho na yang dus gsum pa yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only the three are of the three times, but the efficient cause is not like that, because it is ascertained.

original: ji ltar de lta ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de lta ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not like that?

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas dus thams cad pa dang dus dang bral bar yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas dus thams cad pa dang dus dang bral bar yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The efficient cause should be understood as existing in all times and as being free from time, because its time is not specified.

original: rang las gzhan pa rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
translated: All phenomena, excluding its own entity, are the efficient cause of anything other than itself.

original: de'i phyir na de ltar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de ltar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is like that, but not otherwise.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni phan tshun ltos pa yin pas de'i rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i 'bras bu de gang zhe na zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni phan tshun ltos pa yin pas de'i rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i 'bras bu de gang zhe na zhes 'dri'o //
translated: Cause and effect are mutually dependent. Therefore, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the effect of those causes?‚Äù

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
translated: The root text responds, ‚ÄúThe effect is a conditioned entity and a possession.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa chos thams cad 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa chos thams cad 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that all entities except for space and the cessation that is due to a deliberation are effects.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pas na 'di'i @204a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te / 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pas na 'di'i @204a * //
translated: If that is so, then unconditioned entities would be both causes and effects.üîΩThe root text responds, ‚ÄúUnconditioned entities are not causes.‚ÄùüîΩIf unconditioned entities are effects, then there would also be another cause that is different from them, because that unconditioned entity would be the effect of that cause.

original: bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyu gzhan zhig kyang yod par 'gyur la 'dus ma byas rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan zhig kyang yod
analyzed: bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyu gzhan zhig kyang yod par 'gyur la 'dus ma byas rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'dus ma byas de gang gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan zhig kyang yod
translated: If unconditioned entities are causes, then there would also be another effect that is different from them, because that unconditioned entity would be the cause of that effect.

original: par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so,

original: 'dus ma byas la rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag med de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag med de /
translated: then cause and effect do not exist in the unconditioned.

original: bral pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas so sor brtags pas 'gog ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bral pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas so sor brtags pas 'gog ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The effect of separation is the unconditioned, which is characterized by the cessation resulting from the act of discrimination.

original: de la ni rgyu gzhan med de /
analyzed: de la ni rgyu gzhan med de /
translated: It does not have another cause,

original: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not something that is produced.

original: rgyu ni yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni yin te /
translated: It is a cause,

original: 'dus byas skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abides in the nature of not obstructing the arising of conditioned factors.

original: de la 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yang med de /
translated: Nor is there a presentation of effect in relation to it,

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the power to hold or to observe an effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //üîΩ'di la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // 'di la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni mi srid do //
translated: For that very reason, the six types of causes are not possible in relation to it.üîΩThe coexistent cause and the associated cause are not possible in relation to it,

original: de dang chos 'ga' yang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang chos 'ga' yang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no factor is concomitant with it, nor does any factor arise simultaneously with it.

original: 'di la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang 'ga' yang med de /
translated: It has no homogeneous cause at all.

original: 'dus byas dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang sa mtshungs pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang sa mtshungs pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unlike conditioned states and because it is not suitable to be the same level as other states.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang / de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang / de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med de /
translated: Because it is not a contaminated state, it also has no pervasive cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang med de /
translated: Because it is not by nature a maturational state, it also has no maturational cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos ni sems can du bgrang ba dang khams su gtogs pa yin no //üîΩbskyed par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i phyir yang de la rgyu 'di dag med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos ni sems can du bgrang ba dang khams su gtogs pa yin no // bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i phyir yang de la rgyu 'di dag med do //
translated: Because maturational states are sentient beings and are included in the realms.üîΩIt also has no enabling cause because it is not something that is produced.

original: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang med de /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang med de /
translated: Because it is not something that is produced, it also has no active cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: ci'i phyir lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is the path not asserted to be an active cause of separation?

original: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin na 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa yin na 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, if it is established as the nature of not obstructing arising, then the unconditioned does not possess arising.

original: dus su ma gtogs pa'i phyir yang 'di la rgyu dag med de /
analyzed: dus su ma gtogs pa'i phyir yang 'di la rgyu dag med de /
translated: Also, it does not have causes because it is not included in time.

original: rgyu ni dus su gtogs pa'i chos kyi yin par rnam par gzhag @204b go //
analyzed: rgyu ni dus su gtogs pa'i chos kyi yin par rnam par gzhag @204b go //
translated: It is established that causes are included in time.

original: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la rgyu med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la rgyu med do //
translated: Thus, because the six types of causes are impossible, the unconditioned does not have causes.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu yang med do //
translated: Also, the unconditioned does not have effects because the five types of effects are impossible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: re zhig spyir dus las rnam par grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: re zhig spyir dus las rnam par grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In general, that which is liberated from time does not have the power to hold or ripen effects.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu dag /'dzin te gnyis ni 'byin par byed //
analyzed: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu dag /'dzin te gnyis ni 'byin par byed //
translated: The five hold effects, and two give rise to effects.

original: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Such statements occur.

original: gzhan yang re zhig bdag po'i 'bras bu ni med de de ni //üîΩsngon 'byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig bdag po'i 'bras bu ni med de de ni // sngon 'byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
translated: Moreover, the dominant result does not exist for the non-arisen.üîΩThe conditioned is the dominant result

original: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: of the conditioned alone.

original: zhes 'byung bas lhan cig skyes pa dang phyis byung ba yin na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas lhan cig skyes pa dang phyis byung ba yin na /
translated: If it is simultaneous or subsequent,üîΩit does not have a simultaneous or subsequent result.

original: de yang skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'di la 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa dang phyis skyes pa med do //
analyzed: de yang skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'di la 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa dang phyis skyes pa med do //
translated: Since it does not possess arising, it does not have a simultaneous or subsequent result.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
translated: Since it does not possess arising, it also does not have a result that resembles its cause.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'dra ba'i chos skye ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'dra ba'i chos skye ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: A result that resembles its cause is a phenomenon that possesses arising and resembles that which possesses arising.

original: da nyid kyi phyir dang / skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang med de //
analyzed: da nyid kyi phyir dang / skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang med de //
translated: Since it does not possess arising and since it is not created by a person, the unconditioned does not have a result of conscious effort.

original: gang gi mthus gang zhig skye ba'am 'thob pa de ni de'i skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi mthus gang zhig skye ba'am 'thob pa de ni de'i skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That which arises or is obtained through the power of something is the result of conscious effort of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med de /
translated: Therefore, the effect of separation does not exist.

original: bral ba ni lam gyi stobs kho nas 'thob na lam de yang 'dus byas yin no /
analyzed: bral ba ni lam gyi stobs kho nas 'thob na lam de yang 'dus byas yin no /
translated: If separation is obtained only through the power of the path, then that path is conditioned.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med de //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med de //
translated: The effect of separation is not a ripened effect because it is not similar to its cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rgyu ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rgyu ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin na /
translated: The cause of a ripened effect is contaminated.

original: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The unconditioned is not contaminated.

original: rnam pa cig tu na rgyu rnam pa lnga dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pas 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu mi srid do //
analyzed: rnam pa cig tu na rgyu rnam pa lnga dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pas 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu mi srid do //
translated: Or, in another way, the unconditioned is not possible as an effect because it is not possible as the five types of effects due to its dissimilarity to the five types of causes.

original: gal te lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te lam 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that the path is the active cause of separation,

original: da ni de gang gi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: da ni de gang gi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: then what is its effect?

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: An effect must be related to a cause.

original: yang na ji ltar de rnam pa gang gis na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar de rnam pa gang gis na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: Or else, in what way is it an effect?

original: smras pa / re zhig de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de @205a * //
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de @205a * //
translated: First, as for what you said, ‚ÄúWhose result is it? ‚Äù

original: ni lam gyi yin no //
analyzed: ni lam gyi yin no //
translated: It is the result of the path.

original: de ji ltar 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa ni de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin te lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ji ltar 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa ni de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin te lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for what you said, ‚ÄúHow is it a result? ‚Äù It is a result because it is obtained by the power of the path.

original: yang na tshig 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na tshig 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: Or else, the sentence is to be construed as follows:

original: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na lam gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na lam gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Whose result is it? It is the result of the path.

original: de ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a result?

original: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is obtained by the power of the path. ‚Äù

original: 'o na ni lam de thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi bral ba ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'o na ni lam de thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi bral ba ni ma yin no /
translated: But then, since the path is capable of producing it only when it is obtained, only the possession of the path is the result of the path, not the disconnection.

original: ci zhe na /üîΩlam gyi 'bras bu zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci zhe na / lam gyi 'bras bu zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: What is the result of the path?üîΩThe context shows that it is disconnection.

original: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te //
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te //
translated: But it is not the result of the path because it is not capable of being produced by the power of the path.

original: lam ni bral ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam ni bral ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The path is not a cause of the disconnection, because it is powerless to do so.

original: de lta bas na re zhig lam ni ji ltar yang 'di'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig lam ni ji ltar yang 'di'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the path is not a cause of the disconnection in any way.

original: lam ni 'di'i rgyur rgyu drug po dag las gang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam ni 'di'i rgyur rgyu drug po dag las gang yang ma yin no //
translated: The path is not a cause of the disconnection in any of the six ways of being a cause.

original: bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Disconnection is the effect of the path,

original: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is an effect that is obtained, not an effect that is generated.

original: kha cig ni byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa dang / 'thob par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu rnam pa lngar 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa dang / 'thob par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu rnam pa lngar 'dod de /
translated: Some maintain that there are five types of cause: the active cause, the revealing cause, the manifesting cause, the destructive cause, and the obtaining cause.

original: byed pa po'i rgyu ni myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o //üîΩshes par byed pa ni me'i du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po'i rgyu ni myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o // shes par byed pa ni me'i du ba lta bu'o //
translated: The active cause is like a seed in relation to a sprout.üîΩThe revealing cause is like smoke in relation to fire.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni bum pa'i mar me lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni bum pa'i mar me lta bu'o //
translated: The manifesting cause is like a lamp in relation to a pot.

original: 'jig par byed pa ni bum pa'i tho ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ni bum pa'i tho ba lta bu'o //
translated: The destructive cause is like a hammer in relation to a pot.üîΩThe obtaining cause is like the obtaining of a son in relation to a father.

original: thob par byed pa ni yul gzhan du phyin par bya ba'i shin rta lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni yul gzhan du phyin par bya ba'i shin rta lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That which causes obtainment is like a swift horse that causes one to arrive at another place.

original: de ltar na lam ni 'di thob par byed pa yin gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang thob par bya ba yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lam ni 'di thob par byed pa yin gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang thob par bya ba yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the path is that which causes obtainment, but it is not the cause that generates it. And the result of separation is that which is obtained, but it is not that which is generated.üîΩIf unconditioned states have a result,üîΩthen it would be a dominant result.

original: yang ba dag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rnas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu zhig yod par gyur na de ni byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur grang
analyzed: yang ba dag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rnas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu zhig yod par gyur na de ni byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur grang
translated: If unconditioned states had a result, then because it would be posited as the result of the cause of the dominant condition, it would be a dominant result.

original: na / 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
analyzed: na / 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
translated: But unconditioned states do not have those.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir 'di la de yang @205b bzlog ste bkag pa dang rgol bar byed pa /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir 'di la de yang @205b bzlog ste bkag pa dang rgol bar byed pa /
translated: Because this is stated, it is refuted and countered.

original: yang na bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go ji ltar na 'dus ma byas byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go ji ltar na 'dus ma byas byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Or else, if it is asked how a non-compounded phenomenon can be a cause of a compounded phenomenon if it does not have a dominant result,üîΩit is replied: ‚ÄúIt is a cause of a non-obstruction to arising, because it is said to be a non-obstruction to arising.‚Äù

original: skye ba la mi sgrib ba'i dngos pos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te skye ba la mi sgrib pa'i dngos ngo zhes smos pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'di ni 'dus byas kho na'i byed rgyu'i rgyur rnam par gzhag gi 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la mi sgrib ba'i dngos pos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te skye ba la mi sgrib pa'i dngos ngo zhes smos pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'di ni 'dus byas kho na'i byed rgyu'i rgyur rnam par gzhag gi 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that this non-compounded phenomenon is posited as the cause of a non-obstruction to the arising of a compounded phenomenon, but not of a non-compounded phenomenon.

original: ci'i phyir 'dus byas bzhin du 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus byas bzhin du 'di'i 'bras bu rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is its result not posited like that of a compounded phenomenon?

original: de'i phyir // dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir // dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang smin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
