translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it does not have the power to hold or give a result, being free from time.‚Äù

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i chos kho na la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang smin pa'i mthu yod kyi gzhan la ni med de /
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i chos kho na la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang smin pa'i mthu yod kyi gzhan la ni med de /
translated: Only phenomena that are included in time have the power to hold and give a result, but not others.

original: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu dag /'dzin te gnyis ni 'byin par byed /
analyzed: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu dag /'dzin te gnyis ni 'byin par byed /
translated: Five hold results, two give results.

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sgra gzhan gyis bshad kyi /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sgra gzhan gyis bshad kyi /
translated: It is stated by way of synonyms, that is, it is explained by means of other terms.

original: rang gi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not stated by its own term.

original: de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir rtag pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir rtag pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: And if they are impermanent, then they are impermanent, that is, they are definitely impermanent.üîΩThey are not permanent causes.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar de las rgyu dag mi rtag par bshad pa de bzhin du rkyen dag kyang mi rtag pa kho nar bshad pa
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar de las rgyu dag mi rtag par bshad pa de bzhin du rkyen dag kyang mi rtag pa kho nar bshad pa
translated: And they are not objective conditions, that is, just as they are explained to be impermanent causes, so they are explained to be impermanent conditions.

original: yin no // de lta bas na 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin no // de lta bas na 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore unconditioned states are not objective conditions.

original: skyed pa'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin gyi //
analyzed: skyed pa'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs skyed pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin gyi //
translated: The causes and conditions that generate form are impermanent.

original: skyed par mi byed pa'i gang dag yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pa'i gang dag yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not those that do not generate.

original: rkyen ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rkyen ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of conditions:

original: skyed par byed pa dag dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dag dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: those that generate and those that do not generate.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag ste //
translated: The objective condition is not a generator.

original: dmigs ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir chos 'gag pa @206a * //
analyzed: dmigs ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro // dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir chos 'gag pa @206a * //
translated: Because it is merely the object.

original: la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: la bya ba byed do //
translated: The objective condition performs a function in relation to the cessation of a phenomenon because it is apprehended by the present mind and mental factors.

original: gnyis po dag ni 'gag pa la bya ba byed ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po dag ni 'gag pa la bya ba byed ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The two, the simultaneous and immediately preceding conditions, perform a function in relation to cessation because it is said, Two perform a function in relation to cessation.

original: rgyu rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu yang skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu yang skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúCauses also‚Äù is an expansion. A cause is that which generates and that which does not generate.

original: de lta bas na 'dus ma byas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam gyis byed pa'i rgyu nyid du mi dgag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dus ma byas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam gyis byed pa'i rgyu nyid du mi dgag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, isn‚Äôt unconditioned that which does not generate, but is not refuted as a cause that is merely a nonobstructing condition?

original: mdo las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi zhes bya ba ni rkyen ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las so //
analyzed: mdo las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi zhes bya ba ni rkyen ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las so //
translated: The s≈´tra says that it is an objective condition, but not a causal condition.

original: bkag pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bkag pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: There is no contradiction, because it is not contradictory to reality.

original: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The s≈´tras have mostly disappeared, because the four correct collections have declined.

original: 'di la slob dpon ni chos nyid dang 'gal ba med pas 'bad pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon ni chos nyid dang 'gal ba med pas 'bad pa med de /
translated: The master does not strive to refute this, because it is not contradictory to reality.

original: 'on kyang 'dus ma byas nyid yod pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dus ma byas nyid yod pa zhig yin nam /
translated: But does unconditioned itself exist?

original: 'on te med ces dpyod par ni byed do //
analyzed: 'on te med ces dpyod par ni byed do //
translated: But they do not analyze whether it exists or not.

original: 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //üîΩgzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra dang 'du shes dang mig la sogs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do // gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra dang 'du shes dang mig la sogs pa bsdus te /
translated: All unconditioned phenomena are also like that, not only the analytical cessation.üîΩLike form, feeling, etc.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re ji ltar gzugs las tshor ba yang dngos po gzhan yin pa dang tshor ba las kyang 'du shes dngos po gzhan yin pa nas 'du byed rnams kyi bar las rnam par shes pa dngos po gzhan yin pa de bzhin nyid du 'dus
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re ji ltar gzugs las tshor ba yang dngos po gzhan yin pa dang tshor ba las kyang 'du shes dngos po gzhan yin pa nas 'du byed rnams kyi bar las rnam par shes pa dngos po gzhan yin pa de bzhin nyid du 'dus
translated: The Sautrantikas say: Just as feeling is a different entity from form, and perception is a different entity from feeling, and the formative forces are different entities from perception, and consciousness is a different entity from the formative forces,

original: ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga las dngos po gzhan du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga las dngos po gzhan du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: so too, unconditioned space is not a different entity from the five, i.e. form, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas ni rdzas su med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas ni rdzas su med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the unconditioned does not exist as a substance.

original: reg bya med pa tsam zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúmere absence of resistance‚Äù means ‚Äúabsence of resistant, substantial entities.‚Äù

original: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed pa na'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one does not obtain‚Äù means if one does not obtain.

original: phra rgyas dang skye pa skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye pa skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs te /
translated: The cessation of the arising of the proclivities and of birth is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba ni so @206b sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba ni so @206b sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin /
translated: The cessation of the arising of the proclivities and of birth by the power of the wisdom that consists of the deliberation is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas 'gog pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas 'gog pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cessation of the proclivities is the cessation of the truth of the origin.

original: skye ba 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cessation of birth is the cessation of the truth of suffering.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yang gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yang gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
translated: Both are mentioned in order to establish the nirvƒÅ·πáa with a remainder of the aggregates and the nirvƒÅ·πáa without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: mdo sde pa'i lugs kyi phra rgyas ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i lugs kyi phra rgyas ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the proclivities according to the SautrƒÅntika system?

original: de dag kyang skye ba ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis ji ltar 'gog ce na /
analyzed: de dag kyang skye ba ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis ji ltar 'gog ce na /
translated: How can they be eliminated by the power of analytical discrimination?

original: phra rgyas ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bag chags yin te /
analyzed: phra rgyas ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bag chags yin te /
translated: The latent impressions of the ninety-eight propensities are the propensities.

original: skad cig ma dang po la ni phra rgyas gang gi gnyen po so sor brtags pa'i lam gang yin pa de dang phra rgyas de lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la ni phra rgyas gang gi gnyen po so sor brtags pa'i lam gang yin pa de dang phra rgyas de lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: In the first moment, the propensities and the path of discrimination that is the antidote to those propensities arise simultaneously.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni de'i stobs kyis de 'gog go //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni de'i stobs kyis de 'gog go //
translated: In the second moment and so on, they are eliminated by the power of that.

original: de'i stobs kho nas yang srid pa'i skye ba nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pa'i 'gog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i stobs kho nas yang srid pa'i skye ba nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pa'i 'gog pa yang yin no //
translated: By the power of that alone, there is also cessation that does not allow the connection to rebirth.

original: dper na bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dper na bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the remainder of the class of sentient beings who die in the intermediate state.

original: ris mthun pa'i mi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i mi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The remainder of the class of sentient beings is the nature of humans and so on, which has the characteristics of a class of sentient beings,

original: phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: or it is the nature of a self that has the characteristics of the five aggregates.

original: de'i lhag ma ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nar skye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i lhag ma ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nar skye ba ste /
translated: The remainder of that is born with just those characteristics.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma de yongs su ma rdzogs pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma de yongs su ma rdzogs pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: The remainder of the homogeneous collection that dies in the intermediate state is not born due to the incompleteness of conditions.

original: rkyen ma tshang ba ni yo byad la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshogs pas phung po'i tha ma 'chi ba zhes bya ba rnams ris mthun pa mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba ni yo byad la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshogs pas phung po'i tha ma 'chi ba zhes bya ba rnams ris mthun pa mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The incompleteness of conditions is the inability of the final aggregates called death to connect with a homogeneous collection due to the incompleteness of conditions such as requisites.

original: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings yin no //
translated: Therefore it is called analytical cessation.

original: sdug bsngal mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa yin no //
translated: The nonarising of suffering is the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par bshad pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang skye ba'i rgyu phra rgyas @207a * //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par bshad pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang skye ba'i rgyu phra rgyas @207a * //
translated: The nonarising of suffering that is explained as nonanalytical cessation is the cessation of the nonarising of suffering that is the result of the nonarising of the cause, the negative tendencies.

original: ma tshang ba ni so sor brtags pas byas pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ma tshang ba ni so sor brtags pas byas pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since the incomplete is created by analytical cessation, it is not established without analysis.

original: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only analytical cessation.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhas bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa'i phyir gyi shes rab kyi mthus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhas bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa'i phyir gyi shes rab kyi mthus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it ceases by its own nature means that it ceases by itself, not by the power of wisdom.

original: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas de ma zhig na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas de ma zhig na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not cease when it is not destroyed means that if that negative tendency is not destroyed, nonanalytical cessation does not exist.

original: skye ba la gags  ma byas pa can zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la skye ba la gags  ma byas pa yod pas skye ba la gags  ma byas pa can dag ste /
analyzed: skye ba la gags  ma byas pa can zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la skye ba la gags  ma byas pa yod pas skye ba la gags  ma byas pa can dag ste /
translated: Those that do not obstruct arising are those that do not obstruct arising.

original: de dag skye ba la gags  byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'di la so sor brtags pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la gags  byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'di la so sor brtags pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: The power of analysis is the state of obstructing their arising.

original: gal te mi skye ba kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: If nonarising alone were nirvana, then nirvana would be future alone,üîΩbecause the future alone is nonarising, but the past and present are not nonarising because they have already arisen.

original: gal te mi skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gyur na mi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa kho na yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni skyes zin pa'i phyir mi skye ba med na ji ltar mdo las /
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar gyur na mi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa kho na yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni skyes zin pa'i phyir mi skye ba med na ji ltar mdo las /
translated: If nirvana is nonarising, how could the sutra explain:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad /
translated: ‚ÄúOne abandons past, future, and present suffering‚Äù?

original: mdo'i tshig de ni ji ltar drang /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig de ni ji ltar drang /
translated: How do you interpret the words of this sutra?

original: gang gi ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas gzhan yin pa de'i ltar na ni de dag kun du bsten pa la sogs pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag gi mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par 'gyur bas mdo'i tshig 'di legs par drangsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas gzhan yin pa de'i ltar na ni de dag kun du bsten pa la sogs pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag gi mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par 'gyur bas mdo'i tshig 'di legs par drangsüîΩpa yin no //
translated: If nirvana is a different substance, then nirvana is obtained through past and present reliance on the path, so the words of the sutra are well interpreted.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby abandoning the afflictions that focus on that‚Äù means ‚Äúby abandoning the afflictions that focus on suffering.‚Äù

original: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa zhes bya ba la 'dun pa ni ma 'ongs pa la don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa zhes bya ba la 'dun pa ni ma 'ongs pa la don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe desire and passion that relate to form‚Äù ‚Äî desire is the pursuit of a future object;

original: 'dod chags ni thob pa'i don la lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni thob pa'i don la lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: passion is the intense attachment to an object that has been obtained.

original: rgyas par rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag dang rnam par @207b shes pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig /'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na khyed kyis rnam
analyzed: rgyas par rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag dang rnam par @207b shes pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig /'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na khyed kyis rnam
translated: ‚ÄúUp to and including consciousness‚Äù means that you should abandon the desire and passion that relate to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: par shes pa de lta bu de yang spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: par shes pa de lta bu de yang spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If you abandon desire and passion, you will also abandon that kind of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de ltar na dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs pa kho na gzugs la sogs pa sdug bsngal spangs pa yin la //
analyzed: de ltar na dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs pa kho na gzugs la sogs pa sdug bsngal spangs pa yin la //
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúsuffering of the three times‚Äù indicates that the abandonment of desire and attachment is the abandonment of the suffering of form and so on.

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ma 'ongs pa de yang mi skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ma 'ongs pa de yang mi skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, future desire and attachment will not arise.

original: de'i phyir dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang spang bar rung ngo zhes ston par byed do //üîΩder yang tshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba der yang tshul ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags sam zhe sdang la 'dun pa
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal yang spang bar rung ngo zhes ston par byed do // der yang tshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba der yang tshul ni nyon mongs pa 'dod chags sam zhe sdang la 'dun pa
translated: Therefore, it is possible to abandon the suffering of the three times.üîΩThe method is exactly the same here.üîΩThe method is exactly the same here: If it is said that the affliction of the past, present, and future is abandoned, then the method is exactly the same as the method of the sutra, which states:

original: dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig ces bya ba rgyas par sbyar ba 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig ces bya ba rgyas par sbyar ba 'di kho na yin te /
translated: Abandon desire and attachment, which is to say, abandon the desire and attachment that is the affliction.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin gyi /
translated: The affliction is abandoned by abandoning the affliction that focuses on that object.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin pa nyid pas dus gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa yang spangs par rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin pa nyid pas dus gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa yang spangs par rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are not essentially existent, it is possible to abandon the afflictions of the three times.

original: yang na dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩtshe rabs snga ma pa ni tshe rabs snga ma la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / tshe rabs snga ma pa ni tshe rabs snga ma la yod pa yin no //
translated: Or, the intended meaning is as follows:üîΩPast afflictions exist in past lives.

original: tshe 'di pa ni tshe 'di la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di pa ni tshe 'di la yod pa yin te /
translated: Present afflictions exist in this life.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa skad cig ma gcig pa bstsal pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa skad cig ma gcig pa bstsal pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the afflictions are momentary.

original: 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: tshe rabs snga ma dang tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad sbyar gyi skad cig ma gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma dang tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad sbyar gyi skad cig ma gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: All afflictions of past lives and this life are combined, but not a single moment.

original: de'i phyir dper na sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is like the case of those who practice craving, etc.

original: gzhan dag la yang de lta bu mthong bas de lta bu yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de lta bu mthong bas de lta bu yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since it is seen in others, it should be understood in the same way.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig la sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig la sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad ji ltar rung ste /
translated: How could the eighteen types of craving for the past moment be tenable?

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsred par rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad ni dge slong dag bdag go snyam du 'dzin pa yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no // sred par rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad ni dge slong dag bdag go snyam du 'dzin pa yod na /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha spoke from the perspective of past lives.üîΩThe eighteen types of craving are as follows:

original: bdag ni 'di @208a * //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di @208a * //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if there is the thought ‚ÄòI am,‚ÄôüîΩone thinks ‚ÄòI am like this,‚ÄôüîΩone thinks ‚ÄòI am thus,‚ÄôüîΩone thinks ‚ÄòI am existent,‚ÄôüîΩone thinks ‚ÄòI am nonexistent,‚Äô

original: lta bu zhig yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing bdag ni de 'di lta zhig yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni yod pa yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni med pa yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni gzhan du yin no snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta bu zhig yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing bdag ni de 'di lta zhig yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni yod pa yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni med pa yin no snyam pa dang / bdag ni gzhan du yin no snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: one thinks ‚ÄòI am otherwise.‚Äô

original: 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing 'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing 'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro // 'di 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúIt will arise,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will not arise,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will arise in this way,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will arise in that way,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will arise otherwise.‚ÄùüîΩOne thinks, ‚ÄúIt will arise,‚Äù

original: 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / de lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / de lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will arise in this way,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will arise in that way,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will arise otherwise.‚Äù

original: 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa dang / gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: One would think, ‚ÄúWill this arise or not? ‚Äù ‚Äú Will it arise in this way or not? ‚Äù ‚Äú Will it arise like this or not? ‚Äù ‚Äú Will it arise otherwise or not? ‚Äù

original: da ltar byung ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies up to the present.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe rabs 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag sbyar gyi skad cig ma gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe rabs 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag sbyar gyi skad cig ma gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, here the entire continuum of afflictions of the past life and this life is applied, not just a single moment.

original: de ltar rab tu bsgrubs nas 'dod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gnyis po des zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu bsgrubs nas 'dod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gnyis po des zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Having thus established that, in order to demonstrate the desire, he says, ‚ÄúBy those two afflictions,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe 'di pa zhes bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyis da ltar byung ba'i rgyu dang 'di la ma 'ongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir sa bon gyi dngos po ste bag chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi nus pa bzhag la /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma pa dang tshe 'di pa zhes bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis kyis da ltar byung ba'i rgyu dang 'di la ma 'ongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir sa bon gyi dngos po ste bag chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi nus pa bzhag la /
translated: The two afflictions called past and present are seeds, that is, they are the potential characterized by latent afflictions, because they generate the cause of the present and generate future afflictions.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: And when the seeds are abandoned, the two afflictions are also abandoned.

original: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas rnam par smin pa nye bar spyad nas las zad par 'gyur ba nye bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas rnam par smin pa nye bar spyad nas las zad par 'gyur ba nye bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the designation that karma is exhausted when the result of karma is exhausted, since the result is experienced.üîΩBut how is future affliction posited as abandoned?

original: @208b 'o na ma 'ongs pa spangs pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag / des gang zhig spangs pas de spang bar 'gyur ba rgyun la sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: @208b 'o na ma 'ongs pa spangs pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag / des gang zhig spangs pas de spang bar 'gyur ba rgyun la sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: Since there is no seed in the continuum of one who has abandoned that, it is not possible to posit that future affliction is abandoned.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan du mi skye ba spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ni sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan du mi skye ba spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that future suffering or affliction is abandoned as never to arise again because it has no seed.

original: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: And the absence of a seed is due to the power of analytical discrimination.

original: 'das pa 'gags zin pa dang da ltar byung ba 'gags pa la mngon dum phyogs pa la ni 'bad pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa 'gags zin pa dang da ltar byung ba 'gags pa la mngon dum phyogs pa la ni 'bad pa ste /
translated: Since the past has already ceased and the present is not directed toward cessation, effort is useless.

original: gnyen po bskyed pa'i 'bad pa don dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po bskyed pa'i 'bad pa don dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The effort to generate the antidote is useless.

original: dgos pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it would be purposeless.

original: de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags zad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags zad pa ste /
translated: The supreme of those is freedom from attachment. Freedom from attachment is the extinction of attachment.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as analytical cessation.

original: ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas med pa rnams kyi mchog 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dus ma byas med pa yin par 'os zhes bya ba yin no
analyzed: ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas med pa rnams kyi mchog 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dus ma byas med pa yin par 'os zhes bya ba yin no
translated: How could non-existent things be the supreme non-existent? How could unconditioned things such as space, which are non-existent, be the supreme non-existent, which is unconditioned freedom from attachment?

original: // 'di'i lan gdab pa'i phyir med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: // 'di'i lan gdab pa'i phyir med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to answer this, he says, ‚ÄúSome say that the supreme non-existent is nirvana.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang gzhan dag la bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ste gsum du kha skong ba ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang gzhan dag la bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ste gsum du kha skong ba ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third is the third of the four noble truths, which is the truth of the path, because it is seen by one‚Äôs own wisdom and is taught to others.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyes pa cer 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyes pa cer 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What would happen? This means what fault would there be?

original: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What would it be? This means what good quality would there be?

original: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes yon tan yongs su dris pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes yon tan yongs su dris pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What would happen? and he says, The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position would be protected.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What would happen? means What fault would there be? and he says, There would be the imputation of what is not real.

original: nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is, There would be a fault.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mngon @209a * //üîΩsum gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mngon @209a * // sum gyi sgo nas so //
translated: Like form, feeling, etc.  means by way of direct perception.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni las kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni las kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Like eye, etc.  means by way of action.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By way of inference, means by way of inference.

original: 'di ni lan du ma zhig bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni lan du ma zhig bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The term thing refers to the things of attachment, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag dang bdag po dang yan lag dang yan lag can gyi 'brel pa la sogs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag dang bdag po dang yan lag dang yan lag can gyi 'brel pa la sogs pa bsdus te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch things as‚Äù includes the relation of self and owner, part and whole, and so on.

original: dngos po 'gags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yan lag dang yan lag can zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin no //üîΩ'o na de thob par nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa 'di kho na'i thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po 'gags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yan lag dang yan lag can zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ma yin no // 'o na de thob par nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa 'di kho na'i thob pa yin gyi /
translated: A thing that has ceased is not a cause, an effect, a part, or a whole.üîΩWhat is the cause of definitely obtaining that?üîΩThe phrase ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of definitely obtaining that‚Äù means that the obtainment of cessation is not the obtainment of any other state.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes 'gog pa de thob par nges pa gang yin pa ste nges par thob pa de'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes 'gog pa de thob par nges pa gang yin pa ste nges par thob pa de'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the cause of definitely obtaining that cessation?

original: 'gog pa ni thob pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni thob pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa ci yang med de /
translated: Cessation is not related to obtainment in any way,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation of cause and effect and so on is impossible.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAttaining nirvana in this visible life‚Äù means abiding in nirvana that is, in the state of having no residual aggregates.

original: gal te 'di'i dngos po med pa yin na ji ltar thob par rung /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i dngos po med pa yin na ji ltar thob par rung /
translated: If it is a nonentity, how can it be attained?

original: gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'phags pa'i lam thob pas nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'phags pa'i lam thob pas nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the antidote is attained‚Äù means that nirvana is attained because one attains the support that is the noble path, which is the antidote that is the direct opponent of the afflictions and of birth in existence.

original: dngos po med pa tsam nyid du //
analyzed: dngos po med pa tsam nyid du //
translated: It is merely a nonentity.

original: zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas gzhan nyid yin pa bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas gzhan nyid yin pa bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmerely‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúit is merely a nonentity‚Äù excludes the possibility that it is a different substance.

original: 'di skad du sdug bsngal 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du sdug bsngal 'di zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This is what is meant:

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba nas 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni rnam grangs kyi sgra yin no //üîΩ'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bas dper brjod par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba nas 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni rnam grangs kyi sgra yin no // 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bas dper brjod par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù is an example of an etymological term.

original: 'dir 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhir @209b bsgrub pa yin no zhes ston par byed kyi mi 'byung bas na 'byung ba med pa'o zhes bya bar ngo bo sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: 'dir 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhir @209b bsgrub pa yin no zhes ston par byed kyi mi 'byung bas na 'byung ba med pa'o zhes bya bar ngo bo sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù is an etymological term because it is explained as follows: ‚ÄúIt is non-arising because it does not arise.‚Äù This shows that it is a term that establishes the basis. It does not show that it is a term that establishes the nature, as in the case of the term ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äúnot arising.‚Äù

original: go // gang kho nas de 'thob par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni lam gang gis spangs pa 'thob par yongs su rtog pa'i lam de yod dam thob na sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig / gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su brtags pas
analyzed: go // gang kho nas de 'thob par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni lam gang gis spangs pa 'thob par yongs su rtog pa'i lam de yod dam thob na sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig / gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su brtags pas
translated: The term ‚Äúthat which is imagined to be the attainment of that‚Äù refers to the path by which abandonment is imagined to be attained. You should understand that suffering does not arise when that path exists or is attained.

original: ci zhig bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci zhig bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the use of imagining another nirvana?

original: de'i sems kyi rnam par thar zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe'i yin no //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi rnam par thar zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe'i yin no //
translated: The ‚Äúliberation of his mind‚Äù is that of the Lord at the time of his Nirvana without remainder.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the entity‚Äù means just as the object.

original: ldan pa'i dngos po ni gang la nyon mongs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i dngos po ni gang la nyon mongs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúpossession of the entity‚Äù is that in which the defilements are possessed.

original: dngos po dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúdharmas with entity‚Äù are those with cause.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung bar bya ba yin pas na yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung bar bya ba yin pas na yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúentity of appropriation‚Äù is that which is to be appropriated.

original: tha mar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i mjug nas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'byung ste /
analyzed: tha mar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i mjug nas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is taught at the end, the cause of maturation is taught at the end of the metrical verses.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin no //
translated: Its result is only the maturation.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang po yin te /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang po yin te /
translated: The causal condition is taught first because the efficient cause is taught first in the metrical verses.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni bdag skyes yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni bdag skyes yin no //
translated: Its result is self-originated.

original: bdag ni bdag po yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag po yin no //
translated: The self is the dominant condition.

original: de las skyes pa ni bdag skyes te bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni bdag skyes te bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which originates from it is self-originated, i.e., the result of the dominant condition.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some read the verse as follows:

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya bar 'don te /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya bar 'don te /
translated: The first is the result of the dominant condition.

original: 'bras bu 'di bdag po'i yin pas na bdag po'i'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di bdag po'i yin pas na bdag po'i'o //
translated: This result is of the dominant condition, thus it is the result of the dominant condition.

original: 'o na ni dbang byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni dbang byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be called the controlling result.

original: 'on te dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i yul la yang spyir bstan par sbyar ro zhes bya bar 'gyur na ni de lta bu'i ngo bor yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i yul la yang spyir bstan par sbyar ro zhes bya bar 'gyur na ni de lta bu'i ngo bor yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is applied to the general teaching even with regard to the object that is excluded, then it would be of that nature.

original: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam du gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam du gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That itself is the controlling result. That which merely remains as the state of nonobstruction.

original: skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod ces bya ba ni gtso bo'i dngos po yang ste skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod ces bya ba ni gtso bo'i dngos po yang ste skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is also the state of generation. The state of predominance is also the state of generation.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni byed rgyu'i rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms su 'jug pa rnam pa gnyi ga la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu @210a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni byed rgyu'i rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms su 'jug pa rnam pa gnyi ga la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu @210a * //
translated: Therefore this passage indicates that the active cause is both the active agent and the cause that is indifferent.

original: yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus this passage teaches that the active cause is the dominant result of both the active cause and the cause that is the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma gtogs te 'di ltar /üîΩsngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma gtogs te 'di ltar / sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
translated: The unconditioned is excluded, for it is said:üîΩThe conditioned is the dominant result

original: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩskye mched bcu zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched dag nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // skye mched bcu zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched dag nas /
translated: of only the conditioned.

original: lus dang reg bya'i skye mched dag gi bar yin te /
analyzed: lus dang reg bya'i skye mched dag gi bar yin te /
translated: The ten bases are the eye and form bases, up to and including the body and tactility bases.üîΩThe sutra states: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas lus dang reg bya rnams la brten te lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas lus dang reg bya rnams la brten te lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Body consciousness arises in dependence on the body and tactility.

original: 'di yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
translated: This is only the active cause.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rgyu lnga po dag yin par ni mi srid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rgyu lnga po dag yin par ni mi srid do //
translated: The sense-spheres of the eye, etc. are not the five causes of the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe mental faculty is the homogeneous cause of the mental consciousness, etc. The sense-sphere of factors is the co-existent cause, the associated cause, etc. of the mental consciousness, etc.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yin par srid la chos kyi skye mched kyang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yin par srid pas byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yinüîΩno zhes nges par ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yin par srid la chos kyi skye mched kyang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yin par srid pas byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin no zhes nges par ma bzung ngo //
translated: Thus, the sense-sphere of factors is not only the active cause.

original: de lta bas na skye mched bcu zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na skye mched bcu zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Thus, the ten sense-spheres are mentioned,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis zhes ni ma bshad do //üîΩsnod kyi 'jig rten la las rnams lta bu'o zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis zhes ni ma bshad do // snod kyi 'jig rten la las rnams lta bu'o zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: but not the twelve sense-spheres.üîΩWhat is the example of the world of sentient beings?üîΩThe example of the world of sentient beings is the karma of sentient beings.üîΩWhat is the example of the world of the receptacle?

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu la bskyed pa'i dngos po yang yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu la bskyed pa'i dngos po yang yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The example of the world of the receptacle is karma.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni las dge ba dang mi dge bas bskyed pa lung du ma bstan pa yin yang rnam par smin pa yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni las dge ba dang mi dge bas bskyed pa lung du ma bstan pa yin yang rnam par smin pa yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: The world of sentient beings is the effect of dominance of the world of the physical environment, because the latter is generated by the non-virtuous and virtuous karma of sentient beings.

original: rnam par smin pa ni sems can zhes bya ba yin par mtshan nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni sems can zhes bya ba yin par mtshan nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the world of the physical environment is not considered to be a karmic maturation, because the definition of karmic maturation is that it is a sentient being.

original: de lta bas na bdag po'i 'bras bu 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag po'i 'bras bu 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, this effect of dominance is the active cause.

original: mig 'ba' zhig la yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig 'ba' zhig la yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not only the eye that is the effect of dominance,

original: rna ba la sogs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa yang yod do //
translated: but also the ear, etc.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la brgyud pas dbang byed pa ste mig lta bur mngon sum du ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la brgyud pas dbang byed pa ste mig lta bur mngon sum du ma yin no //
translated: It is the indirect control of the arising of eye consciousness, not the direct control like the eye.

original: ji ltar shes she na smras pa /üîΩthos na lta bar 'dod par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na smras pa / thos na lta bar 'dod par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: How is this known?üîΩIt is known because when one hears that there is something to be seen, one wishes to see it.

original: lta bar 'dod pa rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o snyam du bsams pa yin @210b no //
analyzed: lta bar 'dod pa rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o snyam du bsams pa yin @210b no //
translated: It is thought that eye consciousness arises for those who wish to see.

original: de lta bu la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsnams nas lta bar 'dod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsnams nas lta bar 'dod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The nose wishes to smell, the eye wishes to see.

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i // zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The result of natural outflow is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow is the result of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gsungs te /üîΩde gnyis kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gsungs te / de gnyis kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: The result of natural outflow is the result of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow is the result of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive original: skyes bu ni gnyis kyis yin zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //üîΩskyes bu'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ni gnyis kyis yin zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //üîΩskyes bu'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu pa'o //
translated: The result of natural outflow is the result of the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.üîΩThe

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The result of conscious effort is the same as the result of conscious effort.

original: skyes bu byed pa ni skyes bu'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa ni skyes bu'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conscious effort is not different from the entity of a person.

original: skyes bu'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i las nyid skyes bu byed pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i las nyid skyes bu byed pa yin la /
translated: The action of a person is the same as conscious effort, because it is not different from the entity of a person.

original: skyes bu las gzhan pa ni ma yin te /üîΩsangs rgyas pa dag ni las dang ldan pa dag las /
analyzed: skyes bu las gzhan pa ni ma yin te / sangs rgyas pa dag ni las dang ldan pa dag las /
translated: It is not different from a person.

original: las gzhan yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: las gzhan yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: The Buddhists do not accept that it is different from the one who possesses action.

original: de lta bas na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni skyes bu kho na'i yin pas skyes bu pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni skyes bu kho na'i yin pas skyes bu pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the result of conscious effort is the result of a person, because it belongs to a person.

original: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang gi las te bya ba gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang gi las te bya ba gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The action of a dharma is the conscious effort of that dharma. The action of a dharma is the activity of a dharma. The conscious effort of that dharma is the same as the action of that dharma.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir skyes bu zhes bya ba ni chos tsam du zad pas de'i phyir chos byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi skyes bu byed pa zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir skyes bu zhes bya ba ni chos tsam du zad pas de'i phyir chos byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi skyes bu byed pa zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since there is no inner agent, the so-called person is merely a collection of dharmas. Therefore, it is the dharma that is the agent, not the person that is the agent.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúThe activity of the person is like the activity of the person.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na brtags pa'i skyes bu'i skyes bu byed pa ji lta bar chos kyi yang de dang 'dra bas skyes bu'i byed pa lta bur skyes bu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na brtags pa'i skyes bu'i skyes bu byed pa ji lta bar chos kyi yang de dang 'dra bas skyes bu'i byed pa lta bur skyes bu byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as the activity of the person is imputed in the world, so too is the activity of the dharmas. Therefore, the activity of the dharmas is like the activity of the person.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir sman bya rog rkang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir sman bya rog rkang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To illustrate this, he says, ‚ÄúFor example, the foot of a crow, etc.‚Äù

original: sman bya rog gi rkang pa lta bu la bya rog rkang zhes bya ba dang / mi gang zhig glang po che myos pa lta bu'am dpa' bor mthong ba de la glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sman bya rog gi rkang pa lta bu la bya rog rkang zhes bya ba dang / mi gang zhig glang po che myos pa lta bu'am dpa' bor mthong ba de la glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The foot of a crow is called the foot of a crow. A person who is seen to be like an intoxicated elephant or a hero is called an intoxicated elephant or a hero.

original: ci gzhan @211a * //
analyzed: ci gzhan @211a * //
translated: Do other causes also have it?

original: dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dag la'o //
analyzed: dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dag la'o //
translated: Other causes also have it.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag la'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag la'o //
translated: Other causes, except for the cause of karmic maturation, also have it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the effect of the dominant condition is either simultaneous or arises immediately after.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung bar bshad la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung bar bshad la /
translated: The effect of the coemergent and concomitant causes is simultaneous.

original: de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /
translated: That is only the effect of the dominant condition.

original: 'bras bu gzhan lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: There is no other effect that is simultaneous.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba kho na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba kho na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The effect of the homogeneous cause and omnipresent cause is only the effect of the dominant condition that arises immediately after.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni gnyi ga yin no //
translated: The effect of the enabling cause is both.

original: yang ci skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu las gzhan pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu las gzhan pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the result of conscious effort different from the result that resembles its cause and the dominant result?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not different.

original: 'bras bu de kho na de dang de'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'bras bu de kho na de dang de'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: That very result receives the name of that result.

original: 'di ltar de ni rgyu dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rgyu dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: It is the result that resembles its cause because it arises similar to its cause.

original: de'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: It is the result of conscious effort because it arises through the power of that.

original: bgegs mi byed pa'i dngos por gnas pas 'byung ba'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: bgegs mi byed pa'i dngos por gnas pas 'byung ba'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: It is the dominant result because it arises through the nonobstruction of that.üîΩBut that is not so for the result of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'am de ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that it arises either simultaneously or immediately after.

original: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: The result of karmic maturation is a neutral phenomenon.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na dang sems can zhes bya ba kho na dang / lung du bstan pa las byung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na dang sems can zhes bya ba kho na dang / lung du bstan pa las byung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
translated: This is an extensive explanation of the passage: ‚ÄúUndeclared, sentient, and arisen from declared.‚Äù

original: lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Undeclared means unobscured and undeclared.

original: gang la sems can zhes brjod pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la sems can zhes brjod pa yod pa de ni /
translated: That which is called sentient is

original: sems can brjod pa ste sems can gyi rgyun las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can brjod pa ste sems can gyi rgyun las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: sentient speech, that is, arisen from the continuum of a sentient being.

original: lung du ma bstan pa las phyis byung ba ni lung bstan phyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa las phyis byung ba ni lung bstan phyis byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen from declared means arisen after declaration.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dang rgyu mthun pa dag ni lung du bstan pa las byung ba ma yin @211b no //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dang rgyu mthun pa dag ni lung du bstan pa las byung ba ma yin @211b no //
translated: Arisen from enhancement and natural outflow are not arisen from declared.

original: bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par 'byung ba de yang lung du bstan pa las byung bas de rnam par smin pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par 'byung ba de yang lung du bstan pa las byung bas de rnam par smin pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: The great elements of the sense faculties that expand through entering meditative attainment on special absorption also arise from karmic maturation because they arise from karmic maturation.

original: sprul pa'i sems kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi sems las byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi sems las byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: And since the mind of emanation arises from the mind of concentration, it would be similar to that.üîΩThere is no error because the Abhidharmako≈õa declares, Karmic maturation arises later.

original: de ni nyes pa med de lung bstan phyis byung zhes bya ba la phyis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dus phyi ma'i don yin pas lung du bstan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba las dus phyis kho na 'byung gi cig car yang ma yin la de maüîΩthag tu yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de lung bstan phyis byung zhes bya ba la phyis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dus phyi ma'i don yin pas lung du bstan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba las dus phyis kho na 'byung gi cig car yang ma yin la de ma thag tu yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The term later means later time. Karmic maturation is said to arise later, not simultaneously or immediately after virtuous or nonvirtuous karmic maturation.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i rgyas pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig tu yang 'byung la de ma thag tu yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i rgyas pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig tu yang 'byung la de ma thag tu yang 'byung ngo //
translated: Expansion arising from concentration arises simultaneously with concentration and immediately after it.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni de ma thag pa kho nar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni de ma thag pa kho nar 'byung ngo //
translated: The emanation mind occurs immediately after the mind governing demeanor.

original: rnam par smin pa ni sa mtshungs pa kho na yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni sa mtshungs pa kho na yin par 'dod la /
translated: It is asserted that the maturational mind occurs only on its own level.

original: de gnyis ni sa tha dad pa yang yin pas rnam par smin pa yin par thal ba med do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni sa tha dad pa yang yin pas rnam par smin pa yin par thal ba med do //
translated: But since those two minds are on different levels, it is not logical that they are the result of karmic maturation.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Natural outflow is similar to its cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of natural outflow that is similar to its cause, which is virtuous, afflicted, or unobscured neutral.

original: gal te de lta na dge bar 'dra ba'i phyir zag pa med pa yang rgyu dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dge bar 'dra ba'i phyir zag pa med pa yang rgyu dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then because it is similar to its cause, the uncontaminated would be the natural outflow of its cause, a contaminated virtuous state.

original: ris mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because they are not of the same type.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ris mthun pa yin par 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ris mthun pa yin par 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: A homogeneous cause is asserted to be of the same type, but not all states of the same type are homogeneous causes.

original: de ni sa dang po nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sa dang po nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin pa'o //
translated: The universal cause is similar to the stage and to the afflicted stage.

original: gang dang lhan cig ce na /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig ce na /
translated: With what is it similar?

original: 'bras bu dang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ngo //
translated: With its effect.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it similar?

original: re zhig sa las ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar yin la /
analyzed: re zhig sa las ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar yin la /
translated: First, the universal cause is from the realm of desire up to the peak of existence.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bar yin no //
translated: Its effect is also from the realm of desire up to the peak of existence.

original: nyon mongs pa can las ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can las ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: Second, the universal cause is afflicted.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: Its effect is also afflicted.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ji lta bar rnam pa las kyang de dang 'dra ba ni ma @212a * //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ji lta bar rnam pa las kyang de dang 'dra ba ni ma @212a * //
translated: The universal cause is similar to the homogeneous cause in terms of type, but not in terms of stage or affliction.

original: yin no // gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig rang gi 'bras bu de rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya bar khas len pa nyid doüîΩ// sa dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: yin no // gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig rang gi 'bras bu de rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya bar khas len pa nyid do // sa dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin la /

original: mu dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: That which is similar in type is a homogeneous cause and a pervasive cause.üîΩThat which is similar

original: de ni rang gi ris kyi nyon mongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na yin gyi kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ris kyi nyon mongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na yin gyi kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the homogeneous cause of afflicted states of its own type alone, but it is not a pervasive cause because it is not by nature a pervasive state.

original: gnyis pa ni ris gzhan pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ris gzhan pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The second is the pervasive cause of afflicted states of other types.

original: de ni kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ris gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu kho na yin gyi ris gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ris gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu kho na yin gyi ris gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the pervasive cause alone because it is by nature a pervasive state and it is the cause of afflicted states of other types. It is not the homogeneous cause because it is not the homogeneous cause of afflicted states of other types.

original: gsum pa ni ris gcig pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni ris gcig pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The third is the pervasive cause of afflicted states of its own type.üîΩIt is the pervasive cause alone because it is the pervasive cause of afflicted states of its own type. It is not the homogeneous cause because it is not the homogeneous cause of afflicted states of its own type.

original: de ni ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang 'dra ba'i phyir ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ni ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang 'dra ba'i phyir ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: It is a homogeneous cause of afflicted states of its own class because it is similar to afflicted states of its own class.

original: de ni ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i tshul gyis de'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni ris gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i tshul gyis de'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: It is also a pervasive cause because it is a cause of afflicted states of its own class in the manner of being a pervasive cause, and because it possesses the nature of a pervasive cause.üîΩThe fourth is that which is not included in the above three.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum bshad pa'i chos kyi rnam pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
