translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase and so on refers to obscured and unobscured indeterminate minds.

original: re zhig bsgribs pa'i mu dang po ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba'am ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig bsgribs pa'i mu dang po ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba'am ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The first possibility of an obscured mind is that a virtuous or unobscured indeterminate mind manifests immediately after an obscured indeterminate mind.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The second is the opposite.

original: gsum pa ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The third is that an obscured indeterminate mind alone arises immediately after an obscured indeterminate mind.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mu dang po ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'am nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mu dang po ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'am nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The first possibility for an unobscured-neutral mind is when a virtuous or afflicted mind manifests immediately after an unobscured-neutral mind.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The second is the opposite.

original: gsum pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The third is when an unobscured-neutral mind is immediately followed by another unobscured-neutral mind.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those.

original: de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it becomes the entity of the seed of that result means because it becomes the entity of the seed of that result.

original: 'di ni mdo sde pa'i lugs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde pa'i lugs yin te /
translated: This is the SautrƒÅntika system.

original: glegs bam kha cig las ni 'di skad du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las ni 'di skad du 'byung ba med do //
translated: In some texts, this is not stated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi chu'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de'i 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni dper rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi chu'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de'i 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni dper rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the water ma·πá·∏çala in the wind ma·πá·∏çala‚Äù is an example of the result of that.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rten gyi 'bras bu ni chu'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rten gyi 'bras bu ni chu'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: The result of the wind ma·πá·∏çala is the water ma·πá·∏çala.üîΩThe word ‚Äúin between‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúthe result of the support.‚Äù

original: bar du'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi gser gyi sa gzhi dang / gser gyi sa gzhi'i rtsva dang 'bru dang sman la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bar du'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi gser gyi sa gzhi dang / gser gyi sa gzhi'i rtsva dang 'bru dang sman la sogs pa ste /
translated: The result of the water ma·πá·∏çala is the golden ground, and the result of the golden ground is the grass, grain, medicinal herbs, etc.

original: rten gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rten gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The result of the support is the result of the support.

original: mi sdug pa'i ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas bzung ste /
translated: The result of the meditation on the impurities is the applications of mindfulness, etc.,

original: mi skye ba shes pa'i bar @219a * //üîΩlta bu ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa'i bar @219a * // lta bu ste /
translated: up to the knowledge of the nonarising of things.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the four formless states of composure.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the loathsome is the four immeasurables.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The result of the meditation on the recollection of the Three Jewels is the eight deliverances.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the Buddha is the ten totalities.

original: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the meditation on the recollection of the Sangha is the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of morality is the six kinds of clairvoyance.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of giving is the five superknowledges.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the gods is the four formless states of composure.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of tranquility is the eight deliverances.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the body is the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of in-and-out breathing is the ten all-bases.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the loathsome is the four immeasurables.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the Buddha is the ten all-bases.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the Sangha is the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of morality is the six kinds of clairvoyance.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of giving is the five superknowledges.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the gods is the four formless states of composure.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of tranquility is the eight deliverances.üîΩThe result of the meditation on the recollection of the body is the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe result of

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams bsdus te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúeye and so on‚Äù includes form, light, and attention.

original: de bzhin du bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //üîΩ'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o // 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni //
translated: Similarly, the phrase ‚Äúresult of meditation‚Äù is a compound in which the word ‚Äúresult‚Äù is elided.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúall of these‚Äù is a compound in which the word ‚Äúare‚Äù is elided.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
translated: These four types of results are included in the categories of the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: rten gyi 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: rten gyi 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The result that is a support is included in the dominant result.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ni skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ni skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi nang du 'dus so //
translated: The result of preparatory action and so on are included in the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nyon mongs pa can ni nyon mongs pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nyon mongs pa can ni nyon mongs pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba dag yin no //
translated: Those that are afflicted are concomitant with affliction and those that are motivated by affliction.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that arise from karmic maturation arise from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: The first moment of uncontaminated states is perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and those that arise simultaneously with it.

original: de dag gi lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gsum po dag gi ste /
analyzed: de dag gi lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gsum po dag gi ste /
translated: The remaining states of those three, afflicted and so on,

original: rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa dag go //
translated: are neutral states that are not karmic maturation, such as those of deportment, skill in arts and crafts, and emanating.

original: zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that are virtuous except for the first moment of uncontaminated states.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba smos pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag gzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba smos pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag gzung ste /
translated: The term virtue includes both contaminated and uncontaminated states.üîΩThe remaining three types of states are all learner and nonlearner paths, such as the collection of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, and all contaminated virtue.üîΩThe remaining three types of states are all learner and nonlearner paths, such as the collection of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, and all contaminated virtue.üîΩThe remaining three types of states are all learner and nonlearner paths, such as the collection of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, and all contaminated virtue.

original: nyon mongs can dang rnam @219b smin skyes //
analyzed: nyon mongs can dang rnam @219b smin skyes //
translated: The remaining three types of states are all learner and nonlearner paths, such as the collection of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, and all contaminated virtue.

original: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //üîΩrnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrnam smin zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //üîΩrnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrnam smin zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The remaining three types of states are all learner and nonlearner paths, such as the collection of Dharma knowledge of the

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga po byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dag las ci rigs par skye ste /
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga po byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dag las ci rigs par skye ste /
translated: Afflicted phenomena are derived from five causes, except for the cause of karmic maturation, since they arise from active cause, coemergent cause, homogeneous cause, concomitant cause and omnipresent cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu dang / rang gi tshogs kyi sems la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / rang gi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa can sngar byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu dang / rang gi tshogs kyi sems la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / rang gi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa can sngar byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang /
translated: They are active causes of all phenomena except for their own nature. They are coemergent causes of their own collection of mind and so on. They are homogeneous causes of previously arisen afflicted states in their own continuum.

original: 'di ltar de dag sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang gi tshogs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa sngar byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang gi tshogs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa sngar byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are by nature mind and mental factors, they arise from the concomitant cause that has the characteristics of its own collection of mind and mental factors and from the pervasive cause that has the characteristics of previously arisen afflicted view of the self, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na //
translated: Because the cause of karmic maturation is accompanied by the result of karmic maturation.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas de dag de las mi skye'o //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas de dag de las mi skye'o //
translated: Since afflicted entities are not by nature karmic maturation, they do not arise from that cause.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu dag lhag ma lnga po kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu dag lhag ma lnga po kho na las skye'o //
translated: Those that arise from karmic maturation arise from the remaining five causes, excluding the pervasive cause.

original: rnam par smin pa rnams nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnams nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise from the pervasive cause because they are not afflicted.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni //üîΩkun 'gro zhes bya ba nyon mongs can //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni // kun 'gro zhes bya ba nyon mongs can //
translated: The definition of the pervasive cause is:üîΩThe pervasive cause is afflicted.

original: rnams kyi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù is like the word ‚Äúall‚Äù in ‚Äúall sentient beings.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag log par lta ba la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba las skye bar 'gyur mod kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag log par lta ba la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba las skye bar 'gyur mod kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Although the pervasive view of the self and so on arise from the pervasive view of the self and so on, they do not arise from the pervasive cause because they are not pervasive.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of those?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They arise from the ripening cause.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhag ma rnams @220a * //
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhag ma rnams @220a * //
translated: The remaining dharmas do not have the nature of karmic maturation,

original: la rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang med la nyon mongs pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: la rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang med la nyon mongs pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: and therefore they do not have the ripening cause. They also do not have the pervasive cause because they are not afflicted.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye ste /
translated: Therefore, they arise from the remaining four causes, excluding the cause of karmic maturation and the omnipresent cause.

original: snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: They should be explained as above.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The first uncontaminated states arise from the cause of karmic maturation and the omnipresent cause.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgras drangs pa de dag dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag las ci rigs par skye'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgras drangs pa de dag dang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag las ci rigs par skye'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that they arise from the remaining two causes: the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause, excluding the homogeneous cause.

original: zag pa med pa rnams la rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams la rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: Uncontaminated states do not arise from the cause of karmic maturation because they do not have the nature of karmic maturation.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: They do not arise from the omnipresent cause because they are not afflicted.

original: lam ni sngon ma bskyed pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: lam ni sngon ma bskyed pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: They do not arise from the homogeneous cause because the path has not previously been generated.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa chos kyi mchog ni zag pa med pa'i tshogs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa chos kyi mchog ni zag pa med pa'i tshogs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The supreme mundane factors that are impure are not suitable to be the homogeneous cause of the accumulation of the uncontaminated.

original: de lta bas na de dag las mi skye'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag las mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, they do not arise from those.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung pa zhes bya ba ni smos pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung pa zhes bya ba ni smos pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúmind and mental factors‚Äù is made to indicate that they are the concomitant cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa la thob pa la sogs pa dang sdom pa gzugs can gyi ngo bo nyid kyang zag pa med pa dag tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa la thob pa la sogs pa dang sdom pa gzugs can gyi ngo bo nyid kyang zag pa med pa dag tu rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the acquisition, etc. of the uncontaminated mind and the physical restraint are uncontaminated even though they are not associated with the uncontaminated mind.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ma gtogs par lhag ma bzhi kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ma gtogs par lhag ma bzhi kho na las skye'o //
translated: Also, those arisen from fruition are produced from the remaining four causes alone, excluding the pervasive cause and the concomitant cause.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnams ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnams ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las so //
translated: The remaining are produced from the remaining three causes, excluding the cause of karmic maturation, the pervasive cause, and the concomitant cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang pa ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rgyu gnyis las skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang pa ni rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rgyu gnyis las skye'o //
translated: The uncontaminated first produced is produced from two causes: excluding the cause of karmic maturation, the pervasive cause, the homogeneous cause, and the concomitant cause.

original: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gdon mi za bar med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskye ba bskyed bya skyed byed pa //
analyzed: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gdon mi za bar med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed pa //
translated: There are no phenomena produced from one cause because it is certain that the cause and the coemergent cause are not produced in the absence of the other.üîΩProduction is not without a cause or a creator.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par min //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par min //
translated: Production is not without a cause or a creator.

original: zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rgyu rgyas par bshad pa'i 'og tu rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rgyu rgyas par bshad pa'i 'og tu rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, after the extensive explanation of causes, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat are conditions?‚Äù

original: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ba lang nyid lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ba lang nyid lta bu yin no //
translated: Similarity in terms of conditions is a condition.

original: sems dang sems byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs par de ma thag pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs par de ma thag pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúMind and mental factors,‚Äù and so on. This passage indicates that only mental factors are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: skyes zhes smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa brtsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zhes smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa brtsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúarisen‚Äù is stated in order to exclude future states.

original: tha ma pa yin zhes smos pa ni phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma pa yin zhes smos pa ni phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúfinal‚Äù is stated because those that possess a subsequent state are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: rkyen 'di mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa yang yin pas mtshungs pa de thag pa'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: rkyen 'di mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa yang yin pas mtshungs pa de thag pa'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù means ‚Äúlike.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúform belonging to the desire realm‚Äù refers to non-informative form.üîΩSometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the form realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a pure meditative state is manifest.

original: res 'ga' ni 'dod pa spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dang gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'dod pa spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dang gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a pure meditative state is manifest.üîΩSometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and uncontaminated non-informative form arise together.üîΩThis occurs when an uncontaminated meditative state is manifest.üîΩSometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the form realm arise together.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan mngon du gyur pa na'o res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan mngon du gyur pa na'o res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung ste /
translated: This occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and uncontaminated non-informative form arise together.

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan mngon du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan mngon du gyur pa na'o //
translated: This occurs when an uncontaminated meditative state is manifest.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems @221a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems @221a * //
translated: Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state is manifest. Sometimes, non-informative form belonging to the desire realm and non-informative form belonging to the formless realm arise together.üîΩThis occurs when a defiled meditative state

original: kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems cig car ni nam yang mi 'byung bas gzugs sngon du 'gyur ba 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems cig car ni nam yang mi 'byung bas gzugs sngon du 'gyur ba 'chol ba yin no //
translated: But it is impossible for a formless realm virtuous mind to arise immediately after a desire realm virtuous mind, because a desire realm virtuous mind is either derived from preparation or obtained from birth, and a formless realm virtuous mind is derived from preparation alone.üîΩThe second is because it arises.

original: gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /üîΩgang gi tshe zas zos nas nyal ba 'am bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe zas las skyes pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba dang / gnyid las skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir te / gang gi tshe zas zos nas nyal ba 'am bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe zas las skyes pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba dang / gnyid las skyes pa 'am /
translated: The second is because it arises from enhancement.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When one eats food and then sleeps or enters meditative attainment, enhancement derived from food and enhancement derived from sleep or meditative attainment arise.

original: btsun pa ni mdo sde pa'i gnas brtan zhig yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa ni mdo sde pa'i gnas brtan zhig yin no //
translated: The Bhadanta says:üîΩBecause many or few arise.

original: chos mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: chos mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant?

original: gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Form is not a condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dag dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dag dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Minds of virtue, nonvirtue and neutral states.

original: 'dod pa'i dge ba'i sems la ni //üîΩrtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dge ba'i sems la ni // rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: The desire realm's virtuous mind

original: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis //
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis //
translated: has twenty two mental factorsüîΩbecause it possesses investigation and analysis.

original: la la dag tu 'gyod pas bsnan //
analyzed: la la dag tu 'gyod pas bsnan //
translated: Some add regret to that.üîΩNonvirtuous minds have twenty

original: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lha dang ldan na 'ang nyi shu 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lha dang ldan na 'ang nyi shu 'byung //
translated: when they possess anger and so on.

original: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig //
analyzed: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig //
translated: When they possess the four root afflictions, anger and so on and regret, they have twenty one.

original: bsgribs la bco brgyad lung ma bstan //
analyzed: bsgribs la bco brgyad lung ma bstan //
translated: Obscured minds have eighteen.

original: gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
translated: Others assert twelve.

original: ces bya ba'i rim pa 'dis res 'ga' ni sems las byung ba mang po nyi shu rtsa gsum las sems las byung ba nyung ngu nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bco brgyad dam bcu gnyis 'byung la res 'ga' ni nyung ngu las mang po 'byung ste bzlog pa yin
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rim pa 'dis res 'ga' ni sems las byung ba mang po nyi shu rtsa gsum las sems las byung ba nyung ngu nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bco brgyad dam bcu gnyis 'byung la res 'ga' ni nyung ngu las mang po 'byung ste bzlog pa yin
translated: Sometimes twenty three mental factors arise from a single mind, sometimes twenty one, eighteen or twelve mental factors arise from a single mind. Sometimes more arise from fewer and sometimes fewer arise from more.

original: no // rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: no // rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three concentrations of vitarka and so onüîΩare the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so onüîΩare the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so onüîΩare the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so on

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang yod la /üîΩrtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam yang yod /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang yod la / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam yang yod /
translated: are the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so onüîΩare the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so on

original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa yang yod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di gsum la sems las byung ba ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ste /üîΩde'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa yang yod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di gsum la sems las byung ba ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ste / de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: are the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.üîΩThe three concentrations of vitarka and so on

original: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi rang gi rigs la ni med @221b de zhes bya ba ni rigs gzhan la ni ches mang pa dang nyung ngu 'byung ba yod kyi rang gi rigs la med do //
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi rang gi rigs la ni med @221b de zhes bya ba ni rigs gzhan la ni ches mang pa dang nyung ngu 'byung ba yod kyi rang gi rigs la med do //
translated: are the three concentrations of vitarka and vicara, the concentration free from vitarka but possessing vicara and the concentration free from both vitarka and vicara.

original: sems 'ga' la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ba rnams 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems 'ga' la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ba rnams 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: Some minds are of a different type, such as those that are analytical or those that are not analytical.

original: nam yang tshor ba tshes mang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nam yang tshor ba tshes mang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But feeling never increases,

original: sems gcig la res 'ga' ni tshor ba gcig gzhan 'ga' la ni gsum mam gnyis zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: sems gcig la res 'ga' ni tshor ba gcig gzhan 'ga' la ni gsum mam gnyis zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: because it is never the case that sometimes one feeling arises in the mind and sometimes three or two feelings arise in the mind.

original: gzugs ni rang gi rigs la yang ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ngo //üîΩyang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni ci gang gis na sems las byung ba la sogs pa ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ba yongs su spangs par 'gyur ba tshor ba yang tshor ba du ma bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir tshor ba
analyzed: gzugs ni rang gi rigs la yang ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ngo // yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni ci gang gis na sems las byung ba la sogs pa ches mang ba dang nyung ngu 'byung ba yongs su spangs par 'gyur ba tshor ba yang tshor ba du ma bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir tshor ba
translated: Form sometimes arises in greater or lesser quantity even within its own type.

original: kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin la 'du shes la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin gyi rigs gzhan gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin la 'du shes la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin gyi rigs gzhan gyi ma yin te /
translated: Do the same factors that are homogeneous causes for a given factor also constitute equivalent immediately preceding conditions?üîΩOr do the same factors that are equivalent immediately preceding conditions for a given factor also constitute homogeneous causes?

original: tshor ba ni 'dus shes la sogs pa'i ma yin pa zhig yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni 'dus shes la sogs pa'i ma yin pa zhig yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Is feeling not the homogeneous cause of other feelings?üîΩThose who assert a similarity of continuum

original: rgyud 'dra ba pa dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyang sems gzhan gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyud 'dra ba pa dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyang sems gzhan gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi /
translated: say: The mind is the equivalent immediately preceding condition of another mind,üîΩbut feeling is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of another feeling.

original: tshor ba'i ma yin la tshor ba gang tshor ba gzhan gyi yin gyi sems kyi ma yin bas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyud 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrgyud 'dra bas rtsen ba 'am tha snyad 'dogs pa na rgyud 'dra ba pa dag ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i ma yin la tshor ba gang tshor ba gzhan gyi yin gyi sems kyi ma yin bas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyud 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rgyud 'dra bas rtsen ba 'am tha snyad 'dogs pa na rgyud 'dra ba pa dag ste /
translated: The homogeneous cause is a similar continuum.

original: chos mngon pa pa kha cig yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa kha cig yin no //
translated: Those who assert a similarity of continuum are Abhidharma masters who play or speak about the similarity of continuum.

original: gal te rgyud gcig rgyud gzhan gyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can 'byung ba de la ji ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du rnam par bzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te rgyud gcig rgyud gzhan gyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can 'byung ba de la ji ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du rnam par bzhag ce na /
translated: If one continuum is the active cause of another continuum, then when a afflicted state arises after a non-afflicted state, how can it be posited as a similar antecedent condition?

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: nyon mongs pa ba phyis byung ba de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sngon 'gags pa'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar du chod pa yin par rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ba phyis byung ba de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sngon 'gags pa'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar du chod pa yin par rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: When a non-afflicted state arises after an afflicted state, the afflicted state that arises later is posited as the similar antecedent condition of the former afflicted state that was previously obstructed by another moment of a non-afflicted state.

original: rigs mthun pa'i sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not obstructed by another mind of a similar type.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin bas par du chod pa ni bar du chod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /üîΩrigs mi @222a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin bas par du chod pa ni bar du chod pa ma yin pa kho na ste / rigs mi @222a * //
translated: That which is obstructed by a non-afflicted state is not obstructed at all.

original: mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not of a similar type.

original: dper na ldang ba'i sems kyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na ldang ba'i sems kyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the mind of arising that is the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the mind that enters meditative attainment in the absorption of cessation.

original: sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas kyis bar du chod kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag pa de dang 'dra'o //üîΩkhams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thob pa'i mjug thogs su khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas kyis bar du chod kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag pa de dang 'dra'o // khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thob pa'i mjug thogs su khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma
translated: Even though the substance of meditative attainment is obstructed, it is posited as the equivalent immediately preceding condition because it is not obstructed by other minds.üîΩBecause those that are not concomitant with the three realms manifest simultaneously.

original: yin pa rnams kyi thob pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: yin pa rnams kyi thob pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: When ƒÅryas who are not free from attachment to the desire realm manifest the obtainment of desire realm states, the obtainment of those that are not concomitant with the three realms arises.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they possess affliction of the three realms.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'byung ste /
translated: The arising and so on of those is similar.

original: de ltar na 'chol bar mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed thob pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'chol bar mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed thob pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Thus obtainment and so on, which are nonassociated compositional factors that manifest in a random way, are not equivalent immediately preceding conditions.üîΩWhy don‚Äôt you assert that future states are equivalent immediately preceding conditions?

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gong du /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gong du /
translated: The above explanation that past and present states are equivalent immediately preceding conditions is based on the statement:

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Arisen minds and mental factors

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bshad pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par bshad de /
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bshad pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par bshad de /
translated: are equivalent immediately preceding conditions, except for the final mind and mental factors of an arhat.

original: de'i phyir de skad du 'dri'o //üîΩ'chol ba yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni 'chol bar 'dug pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de skad du 'dri'o // 'chol ba yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni 'chol bar 'dug pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore this question is asked.üîΩBecause the future is random.üîΩThe future is not asserted to be an equivalent immediately preceding condition because the future is random.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol bar 'dug pa nyid ni snga phyi med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol bar 'dug pa nyid ni snga phyi med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The future is random because there is no sequence of earlier and later.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the prior and subsequent do not exist.

original: dus snga ma dang phyi ma dang ldan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi bas sngar zhes brjod par ni nus na /
analyzed: dus snga ma dang phyi ma dang ldan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi bas sngar zhes brjod par ni nus na /
translated: It is possible to say that the present is prior to the past because it possesses prior and subsequent parts.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med do //
translated: But the future does not have prior and subsequent parts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir da ltar gyi yang da ltar gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir da ltar gyi yang da ltar gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod de /
translated: For that very reason, the present is not considered to be the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the present,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present does not have prior and subsequent parts.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is inferred from past and present action.

original: 'das pa las rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa'i @222b dus gzigs zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'das pa las rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa'i @222b dus gzigs zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the past is inferred from the present, he says, ‚ÄúThe past is seen by the Buddha.‚Äù

original: da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs da ltar ba'i las 'di yang de lta bu yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs da ltar ba'i las 'di yang de lta bu yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of present karma, he says, ‚ÄúBecause future and present karma are also like that.‚Äù

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne would not know the future‚Äù means that his omniscience would be impaired.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sign of the effect‚Äù means the mark of the effect.

original: mngon sum du mdzad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gzigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mdzad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gzigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not directly perceived‚Äù means it is not directly seen.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pas 'chol bar 'dug pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod do zhes bshad pa dang / ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pas 'chol bar 'dug pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod do zhes bshad pa dang / ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the past and future do not exist, the present is not accepted as the equivalent immediately preceding condition‚Äù is explained in the statement, ‚ÄúWhy is it not accepted that the present is the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the future?‚Äù

original: de la bye brag tu smra bas lan gdab pa'i phyir gang zhig gang la rag lus te skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de la bye brag tu smra bas lan gdab pa'i phyir gang zhig gang la rag lus te skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: That which arises in dependence on something arises immediately after that.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i chos gang zhig 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gang la rag las te skye ba de ni de'i mjug thogs su skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i chos gang zhig 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gang la rag las te skye ba de ni de'i mjug thogs su skye'o //
translated: That dharma which is the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises immediately after the supreme mundane state on which it depends.üîΩFor example, it is like a sprout arising in dependence on a seed, even though the condition as the equivalent immediately preceding state does not exist.

original: dper na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin te myu gu ni sa bon la rag las te skye ba yin pas de'i mjug thogs su skye la sdong bu la sogs pa yang myu gu
analyzed: dper na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin te myu gu ni sa bon la rag las te skye ba yin pas de'i mjug thogs su skye la sdong bu la sogs pa yang myu gu
translated: A sprout arises immediately after a seed because it arises in dependence on a seed. A stem and so on arise in dependence on a sprout.

original: la sogs pa la de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa la de dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are like a sprout.üîΩEven though the condition as the equivalent immediately preceding state does not exist,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du yang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med par yang ngo //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du yang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med par yang ngo //
translated: means even though the condition as the equivalent immediately preceding state does not exist.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod na lta ha cang yang skye bar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod na lta ha cang yang skye bar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù implies that if the condition of an equivalent immediately antecedent state exists, then it would be produced.

original: de lta bas na tshig gi don ni go rims des par gnas pa yang med la de dang 'dra bar mjug thogs su skye bar nges par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshig gi don ni go rims des par gnas pa yang med la de dang 'dra bar mjug thogs su skye bar nges par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is that the order of the factors is not fixed and that it is not the case that the factors are definitely produced in the order in which they are listed.

original: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rnams zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba 'di ni tha ma ma yin zhes bshad pas byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma rnams zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba 'di ni tha ma ma yin zhes bshad pas byung ba yin no //
translated: The question, ‚ÄúWhy are the final thoughts and thoughtconcomitants of an arhat not a condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent?‚Äù is raised because it was stated that the final thoughts and thoughtconcomitants are not equivalent and immediate antecedent conditions.

original: sems gzhan dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar mjug thogs su sems gzhan dang 'brel ba med pas so //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar mjug thogs su sems gzhan dang 'brel ba med pas so //
translated: Because they are not related to another thought. In this way, they are not related to another thought that would immediately follow them.

original: yid ni rten @223a * //
analyzed: yid ni rten @223a * //
translated: The mind is the support of the thoughtconcomitants.

original: gyi dngos pos rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni dper na mig skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gnas pa gal te rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye yang de la mig gis ma lan
analyzed: gyi dngos pos rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni dper na mig skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gnas pa gal te rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye yang de la mig gis ma lan
translated: The last moment of consciousness of an arhat is distinguished by its state as a condition, just as the arising of the eye sense faculty is distinguished by its state as the basis of eye consciousness.

original: pa de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma yang rkyen gyi dngos por gnas la rgyu gzhan ma tshang bas ni rnam par shes pa mi skye bar zad de des lan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma yang rkyen gyi dngos por gnas la rgyu gzhan ma tshang bas ni rnam par shes pa mi skye bar zad de des lan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the eye sense faculty does not arise due to the incompleteness of other causes, it is not due to the fault of the eye sense faculty.

original: de ni byed pas rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni byed pas rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not distinguished by its function,

original: skyed par byed pa'i skyes bu'i byed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i skyes bu'i byed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is not distinguished by the function of an agent who generates it.

original: gal te de skyed par byed pas rab tu phye ba yin par gyur na ni de 'bras bu skye ba kho na yin na yid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de skyed par byed pas rab tu phye ba yin par gyur na ni de 'bras bu skye ba kho na yin na yid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were distinguished by generating it, it would be the mind that generates the result, but that is not so.

original: de'i phyir de ni bskyed par bya ba med kyang yid yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bskyed par bya ba med kyang yid yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the mind alone that is the equivalent immediately preceding condition, even though there is nothing to be generated.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni byed pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni byed pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The equivalent immediately preceding condition is distinguished by its activity.

original: bskyed par bya ba yod pa kho na yin na mtshungs pa yin pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi med na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yod pa kho na yin na mtshungs pa yin pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi med na ni ma yin no //
translated: When there is something to be generated, it is the equivalent immediately preceding condition, but not when there is nothing.

original: des chos gang 'bras bur bzung ba ste /
analyzed: des chos gang 'bras bur bzung ba ste /
translated: Whatever dharma is taken as the effect by that,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen des chos gang zhig 'di bskyed par bya'o zhes 'bras bur gzung ba de ni chos blo dang mi ldan pa thams cad dam srog chags ched du bsams shing byed pa thams cad kyis kyang ji ltar mi skye bar 'gyur ba ste
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen des chos gang zhig 'di bskyed par bya'o zhes 'bras bur gzung ba de ni chos blo dang mi ldan pa thams cad dam srog chags ched du bsams shing byed pa thams cad kyis kyang ji ltar mi skye bar 'gyur ba ste
translated: whatever dharma is taken as the effect by that equivalent immediately preceding condition, thinking ‚ÄúI will generate this,‚Äù that dharma will not arise in any way for all those who lack the mind or all living beings who act intentionally.

original: de mi skye bar bya'o zhes dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de mi skye bar bya'o zhes dgag par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot prevent it, thinking ‚ÄúI will prevent its arising.‚Äù

original: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can de dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dag yin te /
analyzed: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can de dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dag yin te /
translated: They are concomitant with mind and are immediately antecedent.

original: de dag ni sems dang mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa yang yin pas /üîΩsems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa yang yin pas / sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin no //
translated: They are concomitant with mind and are immediately antecedent.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di dag la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yod pas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di dag la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yod pas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin te /
translated: Alternatively, they are concomitant with mind and are immediately antecedent because they exist in the immediately preceding mind that is concomitant with mind.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa dag yin no //
translated: They are concomitant with mind and are immediately antecedent because they are not obstructed by other moments.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang snyoms @223b par 'jug pa gnyis po 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang snyoms @223b par 'jug pa gnyis po 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag yin gyi /
translated: Also, those minds that possess equivalent immediately preceding minds are minds and mental factors and the two meditative attainments, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'du shes med pa ni las kyi mthus skye ba'i phyir bstan bcos las sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa ni las kyi mthus skye ba'i phyir bstan bcos las sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But the treatise Attainment of Knowledge does not state that nondiscernment possesses equivalent immediately preceding minds because it arises through the power of karma.

original: mu dang po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems ni snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: mu dang po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems ni snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: The first possibility is that which arises from meditative attainment, for the mind that arises from meditative attainment is generated by the mind that enters meditative attainment.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig mas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig mas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it possesses equivalent immediately preceding minds but does not possess immediately preceding minds because the moment of meditative attainment interrupts the continuum of minds.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The second moment of meditative attainment and so on are called those except for the first moment.

original: rkyen des bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi ci rigs par skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen des bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi ci rigs par skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: They are equivalent immediately preceding minds because they are generated by that condition, but they are not equivalent immediately preceding minds that are obstructed by other moments, such as the first moment and so on.

original: mu gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second possibility is the generation and so on of the first moment of meditative attainment.

original: skad cig ma gzhan gyis par du ma chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan gyis par du ma chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: They are equivalent immediately preceding minds because they are not obstructed by other moments, but they are not equivalent immediately preceding minds that are not by nature equivalent immediately preceding minds.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: The equivalent immediately preceding condition of mind is asserted to be only the two meditative attainments and the minds and mental factors.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni de dag khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi skye ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni de dag khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi skye ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The birth, etc., of the mind and mental factors are the birth, etc., of all minds and mental factors because they are not specified.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ma gtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad bsdu ba kho na ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ma gtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad bsdu ba kho na ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes all nonassociated formative factors except for the two meditative attainments.

original: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid du sems kyi de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid du sems kyi de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: They are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind, but not equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind because they are like the former.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems kyi mjug thogs su sems 'byung ba de'i tshe sems dang sems las @224a * //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems kyi mjug thogs su sems 'byung ba de'i tshe sems dang sems las @224a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen the mind is present‚Äù refers to the state when the mind arises immediately after the mind.

original: byung ba phyi ma rnams sems snga mas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la /
analyzed: byung ba phyi ma rnams sems snga mas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la /
translated: At that time, the subsequent mind and mental factors possess the equivalent immediately preceding mind of the prior mind.

original: sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: But they do not possess the immediately preceding mind.

original: mu bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth alternative is the arising, etc., of the mind that is conjoined with the second moment of meditative attainment, etc.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang ma yin la /
translated: Because they are not by nature the equivalent immediately preceding mind, they do not possess the equivalent immediately preceding mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: But because they are obstructed by the first moment of meditative attainment, etc., they do not possess the immediately preceding mind.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa dag go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩmu dang po ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnams te de dag ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa dag go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / mu dang po ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnams te de dag ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: The third and fourth possibilities are the first and second, respectively.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pas de'i de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pas de'i de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The first possibility is the first moment of meditative attainment and all states with minds because they are generated by the equivalent immediately preceding condition, they possess equivalent immediately preceding minds but they do not possess immediately preceding meditative attainment because the first moment of meditative attainment does not have a prior moment of meditative attainment and it is not by nature the immediately preceding state of that.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because meditative attainment does not exist in states with minds.

original: gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second is the arising of the mind of emergence and so on in the second moment of meditative attainment and so on.

original: chos 'di dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin gyi sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: These phenomena are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of meditative attainment but not equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind.

original: gsum pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang pa'i sems dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang pa'i sems dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The third is the mind that arises from the meditative attainment of mindless meditative attainment and the second moment of meditative attainment and so on.

original: 'di dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang yin no //
translated: These are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind and equivalent immediately preceding conditions of meditative attainment.

original: bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the arising of the first moment of meditative attainment and so on and the arising of the first moment of mind and so on in the state of possessing mind.

original: chos 'di dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang ma yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang ma yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: These dharmas are not similar and immediately antecedent to mind, nor are they similar and immediately antecedent to meditative development.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo @224b nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi ngo bo @224b nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not by nature similar and immediately antecedent to mind, and because the prior moment of meditative development does not exist.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa'i 'o //
translated: Together with their associates means together with mental factors.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin par phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin par phyir ro //
translated: Because they have such a nature means because they have the nature of being objects of observation.

original: skye mched dang rdzas dang skad cig ma nges pas zhes bya ba ni skye mched dang rdzas dang skad cig ma yin te de dag nges pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang rdzas dang skad cig ma nges pas zhes bya ba ni skye mched dang rdzas dang skad cig ma yin te de dag nges pa'o //
translated: Because of the definiteness of the sense sphere, substance, and moment means that they are the sense sphere, substance, and moment, and they are definite.

original: des na sems dang sems las byung ba 'di dag rang gis dmigs pa la nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems dang sems las byung ba 'di dag rang gis dmigs pa la nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these minds and mental factors are definite with regard to their own objects of observation.

original: dper na re zhig mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched la nges kyi sgra'i skye mched la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na re zhig mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched la nges kyi sgra'i skye mched la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, the eye consciousness and its concomitant states are ascertained with respect to the focal object, the form base, but not with respect to the sound base and so on.

original: skye mched nges pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: skye mched nges pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Such is the ascertainment of the bases.

original: skye mched de la yang rdzas nges pas ni gzugs sngon po la mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa sngon po 'dzin par byed pa yin par nges kyi ser po la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched de la yang rdzas nges pas ni gzugs sngon po la mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa sngon po 'dzin par byed pa yin par nges kyi ser po la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, with respect to that base, the eye consciousness and its concomitant states are ascertained with respect to the substance of form, since they definitely apprehend blue form, but not yellow form and so on.

original: dmigs pa gzugs sngon po de la yang gzugs sngon po'i skad cig ma gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzugs sngon po de la yang gzugs sngon po'i skad cig ma gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, with respect to the focal object, blue form, the moment of blue form that is the focal object of a certain consciousness is just that and not another.

original: skad cig ma nges bas ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nges bas ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Such is the ascertainment of the moment.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa la yang rna bal sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa la yang rna bal sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to sound and so on, and to the ear consciousness and so on.üîΩDo they have a definite support?

original: ci rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci sems dang sems las byung ba 'di dag mig la sogs pa'i rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci sems dang sems las byung ba 'di dag mig la sogs pa'i rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
