translated: This means: Do these minds and mental factors have a definite support, such as the eye?

original: smras pa / de bzhin de de lta lta yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin de de lta lta yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The answer is: They are like that.

original: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa bas te /
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa bas te /
translated: This condition is superior, therefore it is the dominant condition.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni po zos nas rgyu sngar zad la dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ma yin pas lhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni po zos nas rgyu sngar zad la dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ma yin pas lhag pa ma yin no //
translated: The causal condition is not superior, because the cause is exhausted before the effect. The objective condition is not superior, because co-arisen factors are not its object.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yid la zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yid la zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos nas so //
translated: The objective condition is all phenomena, which means that it is in relation to mental consciousness.

original: yang lhag pa'i rkyen yin te zhes bya ba gong du ni bdag po lhag pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes @225a * //
analyzed: yang lhag pa'i rkyen yin te zhes bya ba gong du ni bdag po lhag pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes @225a * //
translated: Moreover, it is the dominant condition, which means that the dominant condition is the dominant factor.

original: tshig bsdus pa yin no //üîΩda ni lhag pa'i ste /üîΩmang po'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: tshig bsdus pa yin no // da ni lhag pa'i ste / mang po'i bdag po ste /
translated: This is a condensed expression.üîΩNow, the dominant condition is the dominant factor.

original: de rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The dominant condition is the dominant factor.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Everything is the objective domain of the mind.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa thams cad kyi rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa thams cad kyi rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is all conditioned and unconditioned states, since they are the conditions of all conditioned states that have an object and all conditioned and unconditioned states that do not have an object, except for their own nature.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na'i yin gyi dmigs pa med pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na'i yin gyi dmigs pa med pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: The objective condition is only that which has an object, not that which does not have an object.

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba dang po la ni rkyen lhag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba dang po la ni rkyen lhag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the first formulation, the condition is taught as a remainder.

original: gnyis pa la ni rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In the second, it is taught as possessing a condition.

original: 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa kho na la zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa kho na la zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit functions to cease‚Äù means that it functions to cease alone.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rten mtshungs pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyud dag dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rten mtshungs pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyud dag dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because they are reciprocal results and because they are the same support, they are, respectively, coemergent causes and concomitant causes.

original: gsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba kho na la zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba kho na la zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe three function in relation to arising‚Äù means that they function in relation to arising alone.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe opposite of those conditions‚Äù refers to the opposite of those conditions that were explained earlier.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen de dag las bzlog pa yin zhes bya ba ni phyis bshad pa'i byed pa'i dus nges pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen de dang sbyar te skye ba la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don yin la
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen de dag las bzlog pa yin zhes bya ba ni phyis bshad pa'i byed pa'i dus nges pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen de dang sbyar te skye ba la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don yin la
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe time of functioning‚Äù refers to the time of functioning that was explained earlier. The phrase ‚Äúit functions to cease‚Äù means that it functions to cease alone.

original: / sngar bshad pa'i byed pa'i dus nges pa ni phyis bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dang sbyar te /
analyzed: / sngar bshad pa'i byed pa'i dus nges pa ni phyis bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dang sbyar te /
translated: The time of activity of the conditions as previously explained is applied to the objective condition as will be explained later.

original: 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it performs its activity at cessation.

original: de ltar na de dag ni bzlog ste bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni bzlog ste bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they perform their activity in reverse order.

original: de'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
translated: Therefore, the condition as equivalent and immediate antecedent performs its activity with regard to origination, because it creates an interval.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The objective condition performs its activity with regard to cessation, because present minds and mental factors apprehend it.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag na sems dang sems las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni gzung bar bya ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag na sems dang sems las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni gzung bar bya ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The objective condition is established as the meaning of apprehension, but past and future minds and mental factors do not apprehend the object to be grasped.

original: 'di'i bya ba 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen 'di'i bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no zhes bya bar go sla bas bdag po'i @225b rkyen gyi byed pa'i dus
analyzed: 'di'i bya ba 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen 'di'i bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no zhes bya bar go sla bas bdag po'i @225b rkyen gyi byed pa'i dus
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits action is just this‚Äù means that the dominant condition is just the nonobstructing state that exists in all circumstances.

original: nges pa mdor ma byas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa mdor ma byas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since it is easy to understand, Vasubandhu does not specify the time of the action of the dominant condition in brief.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are two types of cause means that the concomitant cause, the omnipresent cause, and the cause of karmic maturation are impossible.

original: sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi stobs kyis snyoms par 'jug pa de gnyis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi stobs kyis snyoms par 'jug pa de gnyis 'byung ba ste /
translated: Virtuous dharmas of the same level means those by the power of which the two meditative attainments arise.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rkyen ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i chos dge ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rkyen ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i chos dge ba rnams yin no //
translated: The condition of the similar cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is virtuous dharmas of the summit of existence.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa dag yin no //
translated: The meditative attainment of non-apperception is of the level of the fourth meditation.üîΩThe condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the meditative attainment together with what is associated with it.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma thams cad sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma thams cad sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All the moments of the meditative attainment of cessation are without interval by another mind.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //üîΩsems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtsol ba las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do // sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtsol ba las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like the former, i.e., all factors except for its own intrinsic nature.üîΩBecause it arises from the mental volition, i.e., because it arises from the exertion of the mind, this is the meaning.

original: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent because it obstructs the arising of mind, i.e., because the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the cause of the arising of mind.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: Other things arise from both.

original: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the purpose of restriction and reversal.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ma gtogs pa chos gzhan dag ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ma gtogs pa chos gzhan dag ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis kho na las skye'o //
translated: Other things, excluding the two, mind and mental factors and the two meditative states, arise from both causes and dominant conditions.

original: dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dus dang rang bzhin dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dus dang rang bzhin dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara, puru·π£a, pradhƒÅna, etc.‚Äù include time, nature, subtle atoms, and so on.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la tshig gi don bsdus pa ni gal te rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug gam skyes bu ni med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces gtan tshigs tshol bar byed na dbang phyug las ma gtogs pa'i gtan tshigs
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la tshig gi don bsdus pa ni gal te rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug gam skyes bu ni med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces gtan tshigs tshol bar byed na dbang phyug las ma gtogs pa'i gtan tshigs
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means that if one searches for a reason, asking, ‚ÄúWhat reason is there for this position that there is no single cause, ƒ™≈õvara or puru·π£a?‚Äù

original: byas pas de 'grub pas na khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pas de 'grub pas na khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one would have to accept that reason, because it would be established by that.

original: de khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug gam skyes bu yin no zhes smra ba 'di bstsal @226a * //
analyzed: de khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug gam skyes bu yin no zhes smra ba 'di bstsal @226a * //
translated: Because of that assertion, it is said that the one cause of all migrating beings is God or Purusha.

original: ba yin te /
analyzed: ba yin te /
translated: This is the assertion.

original: yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said that it is completely abandoned.

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
translated: Because of the order, etc., of the world, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ni dbang phyug la sogs pa la mi skye'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ni dbang phyug la sogs pa la mi skye'o //
translated: things are not produced from God, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rim sogs phyir te sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni yul dad dus la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: rim sogs phyir te sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni yul dad dus la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Because of the order, etc., of the world, etc. The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes place, time, etc.

original: yang na rgyu du ma nyid dang thug pa med par thal ba dang skyes bu'i byed pa gzhan bsnyon par smra ba rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu du ma nyid dang thug pa med par thal ba dang skyes bu'i byed pa gzhan bsnyon par smra ba rnams bsdu'o //
translated: Or else, it includes the consequences of multiple causes and of infinite regress, and the denial of the activity of a person.

original: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: If God or another is the cause of the world, etc.,

original: rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos pa ni gal te lha chen po'am nor lha'am skyes bu la sogs pa gzhan yang rung rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byungüîΩbar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos pa ni gal te lha chen po'am nor lha'am skyes bu la sogs pa gzhan yang rung rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ste /üîΩde lta bas na rang gi rgyu brgyud pas mngon par 'grub pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ste /üîΩde lta bas na rang gi rgyu brgyud pas mngon par 'grub pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: If a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.üîΩIf a single cause were the cause of all, then all would be produced at once.

original: 'gro ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu gcig pu can yin no zhes khas che ba de'i phyogs ni rang gi rgyus rim gyis skye ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi khyad par gyis na skyon dang bcas pa nyid du mngon no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu gcig pu can yin no zhes khas che ba de'i phyogs ni rang gi rgyus rim gyis skye ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi khyad par gyis na skyon dang bcas pa nyid du mngon no //
translated: The position that the world is the effect of a single cause, such as God, is clearly flawed, since things are characterized by gradual arising and other such features.

original: de ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no zhes bya ba ni rim gyis khyad par de ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no zhes bya ba ni rim gyis khyad par de ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: The Vaise~ika might reply that the order of arising is due to the will of God.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas 'di ni phyis skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas 'di ni phyis skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar smos te /
translated: The Vaise~ika might say, God thinks, Let this arise now, and Let that arise later.

original: rgyu dbang phyug tu smra ba'i bsam pa ni de ltar na dngos po rnams rim gyis kyang 'byung la dbang phyug gi rgyu can yang yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug tu smra ba'i bsam pa ni de ltar na dngos po rnams rim gyis kyang 'byung la dbang phyug gi rgyu can yang yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: The intention of the proponents of God as a cause is that things arise gradually and yet have God as their cause.

original: 'o na ni 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir la rgyu gcig pa nyid du yang khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bas phyogs kyi chos kyi rang gi ngo
analyzed: 'o na ni 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang phyug gi 'dod pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir la rgyu gcig pa nyid du yang khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bas phyogs kyi chos kyi rang gi ngo
translated: But if you say that because they have different desires, then this is extensive, it is contradictory to the prior position because you assert that they have different desires and that they are a single cause.üîΩ

original: bo las bzlog par gyur par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: bo las bzlog par gyur par 'gyur ro / // / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, because of the difference in desire,‚Äù etc., means that because of the difference in the desire of God, and because of the acceptance of a single cause, the property of the position is contradicted, and so the property of the position is reversed.

original: 'dod pa tha dad pa de dang zhes bya ba rgyas par @226b 'byung ba ni 'dod pa tha dad pa de yang de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa tha dad pa de dang zhes bya ba rgyas par @226b 'byung ba ni 'dod pa tha dad pa de yang de'i rgyu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat difference in desire,‚Äù etc., means that that difference in desire is the cause of that.

original: 'dod pa tha dad pa de'i rgyu dbang phyug la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa tha dad pa de'i rgyu dbang phyug la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the non-difference of God, the cause of that difference in desire, they would occur simultaneously, because of being one.

original: de'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nyes pa gong du bshad pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nyes pa gong du bshad pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That is why the previously explained fault would occur, namely, that they would occur simultaneously.

original: 'on te dbang phyug ni de bskyed par bya ba la rgyu'i khyad par tha dad pa gzhan la yang ltos so snyam du sems na de'i phyir 'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug ni de bskyed par bya ba la rgyu'i khyad par tha dad pa gzhan la yang ltos so snyam du sems na de'i phyir 'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
translated: But if you think that God relies on other specific causes to generate them, then to elaborate on ‚ÄúIf he relies on other causes,‚Äù

original: rgyu dbang phyug kho na yin par ma zad do zhes bya bar khas blangs na nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩde dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu'i bye brag de dag kyang rim gyis skye bar 'dod na rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag rnams kyang yang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug kho na yin par ma zad do zhes bya bar khas blangs na nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro // de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu'i bye brag de dag kyang rim gyis skye bar 'dod na rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag rnams kyang yang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: if you accept that God is not the only cause, then the same fault would apply.üîΩIf you assert that those specific causes arise in sequence, then the specific causes would rely on other specific causes, so the consequence would be an infinite regress.

original: de dag kyang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos la de dag kyang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pas mtha' thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos la de dag kyang rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pas mtha' thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those specific causes would rely on other specific causes, and those would rely on other specific causes, so the consequence would be an infinite regress.

original: sh'a kya'i sras po'i lugs kho na zhes bya ba ni sh'a kya'i sras po'i lugs 'khor ba thog ma med pa zhes bya ba 'di las ma 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a kya'i sras po'i lugs kho na zhes bya ba ni sh'a kya'i sras po'i lugs 'khor ba thog ma med pa zhes bya ba 'di las ma 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: The system of the son of the ≈öƒÅkyas is not beyond this, that is, the cycle of existence has no beginning.üîΩEven if they were simultaneous,

original: cig car yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste dbang phyug gi 'dod pa rnams cig car yin yang 'gro ba ni cig car ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste dbang phyug gi 'dod pa rnams cig car yin yang 'gro ba ni cig car ma yin no //
translated: if the desires of ƒ™≈õvara were simultaneous, the world would not be simultaneous.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'dod pa gang gis 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig snyam pa de ni 'dod pa de las da ltar kho na skye la /
analyzed: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir te / 'dod pa gang gis 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig snyam pa de ni 'dod pa de las da ltar kho na skye la /
translated: Because it arises according to desire.üîΩThat which he desires to arise now arises now from that desire.

original: gang gis phyis skye bar gyur cig snyam pa de ni de las phyis skye'o //
analyzed: gang gis phyis skye bar gyur cig snyam pa de ni de las phyis skye'o //
translated: That which he desires to arise later arises later from that desire.

original: 'di ni ches phyis rnam pa 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa de ni de las ches phyis de kho na lta bur skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di ni ches phyis rnam pa 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa de ni de las ches phyis de kho na lta bur skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: That which he desires to arise in this way at a later time arises later from that desire in just that way.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: de dag la phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between them later.

original: 'dod pa de dag la phyis khyad par 'ga' yang med de /üîΩji ltar sngon rtsom par mi byed pa de kho na bzhin du phyis kyang rtsom par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag la phyis khyad par 'ga' yang med de / ji ltar sngon rtsom par mi byed pa de kho na bzhin du phyis kyang rtsom par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: There is no difference between them later,üîΩjust as they did not begin before, so they will not begin later.

original: ji ltar phyis rtsom par mi byed pa lta bur sngon yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phyis rtsom par mi byed pa lta bur sngon yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Or, just as they do not begin later, so they did not begin before.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skyed par byed pa gcig kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med pas de dag la khyad par med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skyed par byed pa gcig kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med pas de dag la khyad par med do //
translated: Or, in one case, there is only one creator, and there is no other, so there is no difference between them.

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug gi @227a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug gi @227a * //
translated: Therefore, like the desires of God,

original: 'dod pa dag bzhin du dngos po rnams cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag bzhin du dngos po rnams cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur pa nyid do //
translated: things would arise simultaneously.

original: 'on te 'dod pa'i khyad par rnam pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin na ni nyes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa'i khyad par rnam pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin na ni nyes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: But if the difference in desires depends on another cause, then the error is the same as before.

original: de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thabs med par de byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dga' ba de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thabs med par de byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dga' ba de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be the lord of that pleasure, because it is not able to make that pleasure without a means.

original: dbang phyug gi dbang phyug nyid ni 'di'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi dbang phyug nyid ni 'di'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di yin no //
translated: The sovereignty of the lord is that which is made without relying on another cause.üîΩThe same is true of others, because it is not the lord of pleasure, it is not the lord of the other three worlds.üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?

original: gzhan la'ang de kho na dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dga' ba la dbang phyug ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan 'jig rten gsum char la yang dbang phyug ma yin no zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang de kho na dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dga' ba la dbang phyug ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan 'jig rten gsum char la yang dbang phyug ma yin no zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: If the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?

original: gal te yang dbang phyug ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par skye dgu phyung na ste /üîΩgal te skye dgu gnod pa mang po dang 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: gal te yang dbang phyug ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par skye dgu phyung na ste /üîΩgal te skye dgu gnod pa mang po dang 'bral ba ste /
translated: If the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?üîΩIf the lord created the world as a potter creates a pot, then why is he not the creator of pots, etc.?

original: nad la sogs pa gnod pa rnam pa mang po du ma dag dang 'brel zhing gtses pa rnams phyung nas dga' bar 'gyur na de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di ni bsting ba yin no //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa gnod pa rnam pa mang po du ma dag dang 'brel zhing gtses pa rnams phyung nas dga' bar 'gyur na de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di ni bsting ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that he is to be saluted.

original: gang phyir ma lus sreg pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir ma lus par sreg par byed pa de'i phyir drag po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang phyir ma lus sreg pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir ma lus par sreg par byed pa de'i phyir drag po zhes bya ste /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúBecause he burns everything‚Äù means that because he burns everything, he is called ‚Äúfierce.‚Äù

original: thams cad la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of all the other verses.

original: don gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum du ni snyoms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum du ni snyoms par 'gyur ro //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúBecause the other meanings‚Äù means that the activity of a person with regard to such things as a sprout and a seed is directly perceived.

original: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba dang // sa bon dang / zhing dang / chu la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa skye ba la gzhan gyi byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba dang // sa bon dang / zhing dang / chu la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa skye ba la gzhan gyi byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the activity of something other than the causes does not appear.üîΩThe arising of eye consciousness and so on from the eye, form, light, and attention and the arising of a sprout and so on from a seed, field, water, and so on are observed to occur when those causes exist and not when they do not exist.

original: ji ltar de dag yod na yod pa'i phyir la de dag med na yang med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa skye ba la sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa snang ba de lta bur mig la sogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag yod na yod pa'i phyir la de dag med na yang med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa skye ba la sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa snang ba de lta bur mig la sogs pa yang yod /
translated: Just as the activity of the eye and so on in the arising of eye consciousness and so on and the activity of the seed and so on in the arising of a sprout and so on appear, so too the eye and so on exist.

original: sa bon la sogs pa yang yod kyang gang gis na de yang de dag skye ba la byed pa yin par rtogs par @227b 'gyur ba dbang phyug med na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa yang yod kyang gang gis na de yang de dag skye ba la byed pa yin par rtogs par @227b 'gyur ba dbang phyug med na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa med pa dang /
translated: Seeds and so on exist, but if ƒ™≈õvara does not exist, then how could the eye consciousness and so on and sprouts and so on arise?

original: yang de yod na yod pa'ang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yang de yod na yod pa'ang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Also, if ƒ™≈õvara exists, then how could they not exist?

original: de'i phyir de byed pa ma mthong bas rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug la rgyur rtog par byed pa rnams ni gus par smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de byed pa ma mthong bas rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug la rgyur rtog par byed pa rnams ni gus par smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since his activity is not seen, those who imagine that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of things that possess causes are merely paying him lip service.

original: gzhan yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang phyug ni lhan cig byed pa dang po gang dag yin pa de dag la dbang phyug de'i dbang phyug med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang phyug ni lhan cig byed pa dang po gang dag yin pa de dag la dbang phyug de'i dbang phyug med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the primary assemblage of causes and conditions, then ƒ™≈õvara would not be the lord of those primary causes and conditions that assemble first,

original: de dag ni 'bras bu skyed pa la rang gi mthus bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu skyed pa la rang gi mthus bya ba byed do //
translated: because they generate their effects through their own power.

original: lhan cig byed pa dang po ma yin pa rnams la dbang phyug yin pas dang po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dang po ma yin pa rnams la dbang phyug yin pas dang po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The first condition is not the Lord, so the text specifies ‚Äúthe first condition that is not a direct cause.‚Äù

original: dang po byung ba dbang phyug gi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dang po byung ba dbang phyug gi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: The first condition is the cause of the Lord,

original: de ltar na skyes bu byed pa mngon sum yang bsnyon par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu byed pa mngon sum yang bsnyon par mi 'gyur la /
translated: and in this way, the direct cause of the effect is not denied.

original: rgyu dag las gzhan gyi byed pa ma mthong yang 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug yin no zhes bya ba yang nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dag las gzhan gyi byed pa ma mthong yang 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug yin no zhes bya ba yang nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: Even though one does not see any activity of the Lord other than as a cause, the Lord is the cause of the world.

original: de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the first condition does not depend on another cause.

original: dang po byung ba de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rgyu dbang phyug gcig pu kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med pas dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: dang po byung ba de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rgyu dbang phyug gcig pu kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med pas dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: The first condition does not depend on another cause, and it is only the cause, the one Lord. Since there is no other cause, it follows, absurdly, that the Lord is beginningless, but this is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na dbang phyug ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang phyug ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the Lord is not the cause.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la gtso bo ni sems pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la gtso bo ni sems pa med pa yin no //
translated: So too, the chief principle should be described in the same way, as appropriate.

original: de lta bas na de la 'dod pa rnam par gzhag pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma dgag pa'i tshul brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de la 'dod pa rnam par gzhag pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma dgag pa'i tshul brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, with the exception of the presentation of desire, the remaining method of refutation should be stated.

original: gal te rgyu gtso bo gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gtso bo gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the chief principle alone is the cause, then all migrating beings would simultaneously arise.

original: dang po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: dang po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo //
translated: But it is seen that they arise in sequence.

original: 'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni gtso bo gcig bu kho na rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni gtso bo gcig bu kho na rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they depend on another cause, then the chief principle alone is not the cause.üîΩAnd since those also arise in sequence, they would depend on the distinction of another cause.

original: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be supplied in detail.

original: yang 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig pu yongs su bzung bas don gzhan dag gi skyes bu byed pa mngon sum ni bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig pu yongs su bzung bas don gzhan dag gi skyes bu byed pa mngon sum ni bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since you accept that the cause of the world is a single entity, you are denying that other things are the cause of the world.

original: rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i gtso bo la yang rgyur rtog pa @228a * //üîΩrnams ni gus par smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i gtso bo la yang rgyur rtog pa @228a * // rnams ni gus par smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who imagine that pradhƒÅna is the cause of the world are simply paying lip service to the idea of a cause,üîΩbecause the activity of something other than the causes is not evident.

original: gtso bo de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang gtso bo ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtso bo de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang gtso bo ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if pradhƒÅna is the cause of the world, it is not the primary cause of the primary elements, because it is not the primary cause of the primary elements.

original: 'on te dang po byung ba gtso bo'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dang po byung ba gtso bo'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the primary elements that occur at the beginning of creation arise from the cause of pradhƒÅna,

original: dang po 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid de yang dang po mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid de yang dang po mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nature of the primary elements that occur at the beginning of creation would be like pradhƒÅna, because the primary elements that occur at the beginning of creation are not evident at the beginning, and it follows that they are beginningless.

original: gtso bo ni rtag pa yin la chen po'i rgyu yang gtso bo yin pas gtso bo ni snga la chen po ni 'phyi'o zhes bya bar yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gtso bo ni rtag pa yin la chen po'i rgyu yang gtso bo yin pas gtso bo ni snga la chen po ni 'phyi'o zhes bya bar yang mi 'grub po //
translated: But since the primal substance is the cause of the Great One, it is not established that the primal substance is prior and the Great One is subsequent.

original: gtso bo skyed par byed pa'i chos can yin pas rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir des rtag tu 'jug par yang bya dgos so //
analyzed: gtso bo skyed par byed pa'i chos can yin pas rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir des rtag tu 'jug par yang bya dgos so //
translated: And since the primal substance is the attribute of that which produces, it must always be active, because it does not depend on another cause.

original: snang ba ni gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal bar byas nas yang gsal bar mi byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal bar byas nas yang gsal bar mi byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Light, having illuminated the object to be illuminated, does not fail to illuminate it.

original: ngo bo nyid ni don byas pa la ltos pa med do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni don byas pa la ltos pa med do //
translated: The nature of things does not depend on the benefit that is accomplished.

original: blo ma sbyangs pa rnams ni don dam pa'i bstan bcos dag gis blo ma sbyangs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo ma sbyangs pa rnams ni don dam pa'i bstan bcos dag gis blo ma sbyangs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those whose minds are untrained in the treatises of the ultimate, i.e., those whose minds are untrained in the treatises of the ultimate.

original: de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba sngar byung ba rnams ni rang gi rgyu phyis 'byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba sngar byung ba rnams ni rang gi rgyu phyis 'byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of that is the two kinds of elements. The previously arisen elements are homogeneous causes of the subsequently arisen elements.

original: tha dad du mi 'jug pa rnams ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //üîΩ'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba rnams kyi rjes su mthun par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad du mi 'jug pa rnams ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no // 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba rnams kyi rjes su mthun par byed pa yin te /
translated: Those that do not function separately are co-existent causes.üîΩBecause they assist the arising of the primary elements.

original: de dag gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The derivative form assists the primary elements because it arises when the primary elements transform.

original: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na dge slong slob dpon la brten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na dge slong slob dpon la brten pa bzhin no //
translated: Like, for example, a monk who depends on his master.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhan po la yang brten pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhan po la yang brten pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the root text indicates that he also depends on his preceptor.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'byung ba rnams la brten to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'byung ba rnams la brten to //
translated: In the same way, derivative form depends on the primary elements.üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe primary elements are the cause of their arising.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'byung ba de dag skye ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa ni de dag las 'byung ba las gyur pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'byung ba de dag skye ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa ni de dag las 'byung ba las gyur pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The primary elements are taught to be the cause of the arising of derivative form because derivative form arises from the primary elements.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid du ni de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid du ni de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of change because it is the cause of the conformity of the body to the mind.

original: rten gyi rgyu nyid ni rten du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi rgyu nyid ni rten du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of support because it is the support of the mind.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of duration because it is the cause of the continuity of the mind.

original: 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of increase because it is the cause of the growth of the mind.üîΩIt is the cause of distinction because it is the cause of the distinction of the mind.

original: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bgegs mi byed @228b pa'i dngos por gnas pas gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bgegs mi byed @228b pa'i dngos por gnas pas gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the cause of the absence of error because it is the cause of the non-error of the mind.üîΩIt is the cause of the acquisition of the result because it is the cause of the attainment of the result by the mind.üîΩIt is the cause of passing beyond because it is the cause of the transcendence of the mind.

original: lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi zhes bya ba lus kyi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi zhes bya ba lus kyi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang /
translated: It is the cause of the special qualities because it is the cause of the special qualities of the mind.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.üîΩIt is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha because it is the cause of the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types of abstention from sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi las kyang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa kho na brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa kho na brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of verbal action: abstention from lying, malicious speech, harsh speech, and idle speech, which are included in the absorptive meditation and uncontaminated vows.

original: lus dang ngag gi las rnam pa bdun po de ni phan tshun du lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las rnam pa bdun po de ni phan tshun du lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: These seven types of physical and verbal action are mutually co-arisen causes.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs srog gcod pa spong pa yang gzhan drug gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la drug po de dag kyang de'i lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba lta bur thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs srog gcod pa spong pa yang gzhan drug gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la drug po de dag kyang de'i lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba lta bur thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For example, abstention from killing, which is derivative form, is the co-arisen cause of the other six, and those six are the co-arisen cause of that. This should be applied to all.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mig la sogs pa thams cad dang so sor thar ba'i sdom pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i bar yang phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mig la sogs pa thams cad dang so sor thar ba'i sdom pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i bar yang phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: All derivative form, such as the eyes, up to and including that subsumed by the vows of individual liberation, are not reciprocal coemergent causes.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different collections.üîΩThey are homogeneous causes.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba yang rang gi rgyud kyi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba yang rang gi rgyud kyi dge ba yin la /
translated: That which is virtuous is a homogeneous cause of that which is virtuous in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: That which is afflicted is a homogeneous cause of that which is afflicted, and so on.üîΩWhat is the karma of body and speech?

original: lus dang ngag gi las gang gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ste ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las gang gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ste ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is the nature of informative form and noninformative form, which are either in equipoise or not in equipoise, as is appropriate.

original: de rnams gcig ces bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gcig pu kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams gcig ces bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gcig pu kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äújust‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äújust one cause‚Äù means that it is only the cause of karmic maturation.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni de kho na bzhin du mi bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni de kho na bzhin du mi bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The efficient cause is not counted because it is not a cause in the same way.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa la sogs pa'i phyir yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med kyi zhes bya ba ni de 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde can bsam
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa la sogs pa'i phyir yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro // gzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med kyi zhes bya ba ni de 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde can bsam
translated: Also, coemergent causes and so on are not suitable because their collections are different and so forth.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states,üîΩNonvirtue does not exist in the form realm.üîΩThe first absorption is fully accomplished through the joy and pleasure that arise from separation from attachment to the desire realm and from separation from evil nonvirtuous states.

original: gtan dang po @229a * //üîΩrdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan dang po @229a * //üîΩrdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first absorption is fully accomplished through the joy and pleasure that arise from separation from attachment to the desire realm and from separation from evil nonvirtuous states.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med pas mi dge bas dpen pa las skyes pa dge ba gang yin pa de ni dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med pas mi dge bas dpen pa las skyes pa dge ba gang yin pa de ni dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since nonvirtue does not exist in the form realm, virtue arising from separation from nonvirtue is called that arising from separation.

original: rgyu ji lta bar 'bras bu yang de dang 'dra bas der skyes pa la yang mi dge ba med do zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: rgyu ji lta bar 'bras bu yang de dang 'dra bas der skyes pa la yang mi dge ba med do zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Since the result is similar to its cause, it is evident that nonvirtue does not exist there.

original: mjug thogs su zhes 'og nas 'chad de zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i mjug nas te de 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i sems nyer bsdogs pa'am /
analyzed: mjug thogs su zhes 'og nas 'chad de zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i mjug nas te de 'dir sbyar bar bya'o // snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i sems nyer bsdogs pa'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmediately after‚Äù will be explained below.

original: dngos gzhi pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos gzhi pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen entering meditative attainment‚Äù means that immediately after a virtuous mind derived from preparation of the desire realm, a mind of the first absorption level either access concentration or the actual basis arises.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems skye bas thob pa 'chi ba'i mjug thogs su gzugs na spyod pa'i sems bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems skye bas thob pa 'chi ba'i mjug thogs su gzugs na spyod pa'i sems bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is said:

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
translated: The afflicted state of birth

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is all the affliction of its level.

original: skye ba ni 'dir srid pa par mar skye ba yin par bsams pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'dir srid pa par mar skye ba yin par bsams pa ste /
translated: Birth here refers to the birth of the intermediate existence.

original: de lta bas na srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang nyon mongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang nyon mongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore you should understand that the afflicted state of linking in the intermediate existence is also afflicted.

original: ring ba nyid bzhis ring ba yin te zhes bya ba de la rten ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod
analyzed: ring ba nyid bzhis ring ba yin te zhes bya ba de la rten ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod
translated: The distance of support is that, just as the support of the form realm manifests a mind of emanation active in the desire realm, the support of the formless realm does not manifest any phenomena active in the desire realm.

original: pa'i chos 'ga' yang mngon du mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di yin te ring ba nyid 'dis na 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no //üîΩrnam pa ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pas rags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa dag tu ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams rnam par mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i chos 'ga' yang mngon du mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di yin te ring ba nyid 'dis na 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no // rnam pa ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pas rags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa dag tu ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams rnam par mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Due to this distance, the formless realm is distant from the desire realm.üîΩThe distance of aspect is that, just as the form realm is distinguished by the aspects of gross and so on, the formless realm is not distinguished by the mind active in the formless realm.

original: dmigs pa ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pas ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ring ba nyid ni gzugs na spyod pas ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The distance of focal object is that, just as the form realm is the focal object of the form realm, the formless realm is not the focal object of the mind active in the formless realm.

original: gzugs med dngos gzhi'i dge ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs med dngos gzhi'i dge ba ni //
translated: Virtue of the actual basis of the formless realm

original: zag bcas 'og ma spyod @229b yul min //
analyzed: zag bcas 'og ma spyod @229b yul min //
translated: is not the domain of those of lower contaminated virtue.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis gzugs kyi khams kyang mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems kyis gzugs kyi khams kyang mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the mind of the formless realm does not focus on the form realm,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kho na nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kho na nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod ce na /
translated: why is it said that the formless realm is distant from the desire realm alone?

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa dngos gzhi'i sems kyis gzugs kyi khams la mi dmigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyi sems kyi bsam gtan bzhi pa la rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa dngos gzhi'i sems kyis gzugs kyi khams la mi dmigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyi sems kyi bsam gtan bzhi pa la rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs te /
translated: It is true that the mind of the actual basis of the formless realm does not focus on the form realm, but the mind of access concentration to the base of infinite space focuses on the fourth absorption as coarse and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nas lta bur gzugs kyi khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring bar rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nas lta bur gzugs kyi khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring bar rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore the formless realm is not posited as distant from the form realm as it is from the desire realm.

original: gnyen po ring ba nyid ni gzugs kyi khams kyi ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po ring ba nyid ni gzugs kyi khams kyi ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The antidote is distant, as in the form realm, because the formless realm is not the antidote of the desire realm.

original: de ltar na rten dang / rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnyen po ring ba nyid dag gis kyang 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten dang / rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnyen po ring ba nyid dag gis kyang 'dod pa'i khams nas gzugs med pa'i khams dag ring ba yin no //
translated: Thus the formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of basis, aspect, object field, and antidote.

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, virtue of the formless realm does not arise immediately after desire realm virtue.üîΩThe formless realm arises immediately after learner and nonlearner minds.

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su slob pa sngon thob pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su slob pa sngon thob pa 'byung ste /
translated: When entering meditative attainment, learner minds that were previously obtained arise after desire realm virtue derived from preparation.

original: mi slob pa yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: Nonlearner minds also arise in the same way.

original: snyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba ni nyis na sa 'og ma'i dge ba yang sla'i /
analyzed: snyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba ni nyis na sa 'og ma'i dge ba yang sla'i /
translated: Afflicted meditative attainment is called afflicted because it is afflicted by afflicted meditative attainment.üîΩIf a yogi is afflicted by afflicted meditative attainment, then it is better to rely on virtue of lower level than to rely on affliction of higher level.

original: gong ma'i nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no snyam nas sa 'og ma'i dge ba la brten pa'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las kyang dge ba'i sems 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gong ma'i nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no snyam nas sa 'og ma'i dge ba la brten pa'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las kyang dge ba'i sems 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, a virtuous mind arises from obscured neutral minds because it relies on virtue of lower level.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la 'chi ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la 'chi ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All minds of the form and formless realms means that death is possible for virtuous and neutral minds.

original: de las bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba las rang gi sa pa bzhi kho na ste /üîΩmi dge ba ni sa gong ma pa'i dge ba'i sbyor ba nyid yin par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / de ma spangs par sa gong mar skye ba'i sems mi @230a * //
analyzed: de las bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba las rang gi sa pa bzhi kho na ste / mi dge ba ni sa gong ma pa'i dge ba'i sbyor ba nyid yin par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / de ma spangs par sa gong mar skye ba'i sems mi @230a * //
translated: Four from that means that four of its level arise from a nonvirtuous mind.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is impossible for a nonvirtuous mind to be the preparation of a virtuous mind of a higher level and a mind of higher level does not arise without abandoning that nonvirtue.

original: sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba zhes bya ba ni sprul pa las ldang ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba zhes bya ba ni sprul pa las ldang ba'i tshe'o //
translated: After a mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.üîΩAfter a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.üîΩAfter a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.üîΩAfter a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.

original: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa sprul ba'i sems dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa sprul ba'i sems dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang /
translated: After a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dag go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dag go //
translated: After a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven minds can arise.üîΩAfter a virtuous mind of emanation, eleven

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni gdon mi za bar mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni gdon mi za bar mi 'byung ste /
translated: It is impossible that the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm occurs.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not afflictive and because it is not suitable for meditative equipoise, etc.

original: de ni gzugs na spyod pa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems ji lta bar sbyor bas thob par bya ba yang ma yin no //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis las mi
analyzed: de ni gzugs na spyod pa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems ji lta bar sbyor bas thob par bya ba yang ma yin no // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis las mi
translated: It is not obtained by preparation, like the emanating mind of the form realm and desire realm.üîΩExcept for the two afflicted minds of the desire realm and the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm.

original: 'byung ste / nyon mongs pa can gnyis po de ni de'i sbyor ba yin par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ste / nyon mongs pa can gnyis po de ni de'i sbyor ba yin par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The virtuous mind of the form realm does not arise from the two afflicted minds of the desire realm because those two afflicted minds are not suitable to be its preparation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang / dge bas nying mtshams spyor ba med pa'i phyir de ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang / dge bas nying mtshams spyor ba med pa'i phyir de ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, and because it does not link with virtue, it also does not arise from the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang slob pa dang mi slob pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spod pa'i bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis la yang mi 'byung ste
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang slob pa dang mi slob pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spod pa'i bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis la yang mi 'byung ste
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the two afflicted minds of the desire realm and the learner and nonlearner minds‚Äù means that the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm does not arise from the two afflicted minds of the desire realm.

original: / de dag ma spangs par gzugs kyi khams su nying mtshams spyod pa med pas bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de dag ma spangs par gzugs kyi khams su nying mtshams spyod pa med pas bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the obscured-neutral mind to exist there, since one does not link with the form realm without abandoning those two.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not arise from the learner and nonlearner minds.

original: de na @230b yod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyis ldan ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na @230b yod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyis ldan ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the learner and nonlearner minds to possess afflicted states.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gsum zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gsum zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are active in the desire realm‚Äù should be supplied in the above passage.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe /üîΩnyon mongs can gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzir ba la dge ba'o //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe / nyon mongs can gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzir ba la dge ba'o // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat the time of rebirth-linking‚Äù should be supplied in the above passage.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúat the time of rebirth-linking‚Äù should be supplied in the above passage.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat the time of rebirth-linking‚Äù should be supplied in the above passage.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni rang gis pa gsum dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldan ba'i tshe dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni rang gis pa gsum dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldan ba'i tshe dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: A formless-realm obscured neutral mind, since it arises from meditative attainment of the formless realm when entering meditative attainment in reverse order.üîΩA formless-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm.üîΩA desire-realm virtuous mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm nonvirtuous mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm obscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge bas de'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang mi srid de shin tu bskalüîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge bas de'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang mi srid de shin tu bskal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A form-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA formless-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA formless-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA formless-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA formless-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.üîΩA desire-realm unobscured neutral mind, since it arises from the actual basis of the formless realm when linking at death.
