translated: The same applies to the mental continuum, because this mental continuum is powerful, since it is produced from the special meditative attainment, so it does not operate in dependence on two, but it operates without support.

original: ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what he means to say.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang ci zhe na /
translated: Do the same for minds and mental factors?

original: mtshungs te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshungs te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The same is so is to be supplied.

original: ci zhig mtshungs she na phan tshun brten pa nyid de /üîΩji ltar ris mthun pa yang srog gi dbang po la brten nas 'jug la srog gi dbang po yang ris mthun pa la brten nas 'jug pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci zhig mtshungs she na phan tshun brten pa nyid de / ji ltar ris mthun pa yang srog gi dbang po la brten nas 'jug la srog gi dbang po yang ris mthun pa la brten nas 'jug pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: What is the same? Mutual support.

original: sems kyang sems las byung ba rnams la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems kyang sems las byung ba rnams la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: Just as a homogeneous collection is activated in dependence on the faculty of life force and the faculty of life force is activated in dependence on a homogeneous collection, so too mental factors are activated in dependence on the mind and the mind is activated in dependence on mental factors.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i rten brtag pa ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i rten brtag pa ni dgos pa med do //
translated: Therefore it is pointless to imagine a support for them other than those.

original: sems kyi rgyun gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi rgyun gyi 'phen par byed pa'i rgyun ni 'phen pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi rgyun gyi 'phen par byed pa'i rgyun ni 'phen pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause that propels the continuum of mind is the projecting cause.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is characterized by karma and affliction.

original: 'di la sred pa dang bral ba yod pas na sred pa dang bral ba can no //
analyzed: 'di la sred pa dang bral ba yod pas na sred pa dang bral ba can no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúfree from craving‚Äù because it is free from craving.

original: sred pa dang ma bral ba ni sred pa dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang ma bral ba ni sred pa dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot free from craving‚Äù because it is not free from craving.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: In regard to what?

original: gzugs la ste sems kyi rgyun de ni gzugs dang ldan cig 'byung ba'i gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: gzugs la ste sems kyi rgyun de ni gzugs dang ldan cig 'byung ba'i gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: In regard to form, for that continuum of mind occurs in dependence on form that has already arisen.

original: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'phen pa'i rgyu gzugs la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrdo rje'i sor gdub lta bu zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang ldan pa'i sor gdub ste /
analyzed: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'phen pa'i rgyu gzugs la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rdo rje'i sor gdub lta bu zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang ldan pa'i sor gdub ste /
translated: Because it turns away from that cause, that is, because it turns away from the projecting cause which is form.üîΩLike a diamond ring,üîΩlike a ring that is a diamond,üîΩlike a ring or bracelet that is called a diamond ring,

original: sor gdub bam gdu bu la rdo rje'i sor gdub ces bya ba lta bu dang / na le sham gyi btung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: sor gdub bam gdu bu la rdo rje'i sor gdub ces bya ba lta bu dang / na le sham gyi btung ba bzhin te /
translated: like a drink of myrobalan.

original: na le sham dang ldan pa'i btung ba la bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir na le sham gyi btung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin @246a * //
analyzed: na le sham dang ldan pa'i btung ba la bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir na le sham gyi btung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin @246a * //
translated: The compound ‚Äúdesire realm‚Äù is like the compound ‚Äúdrink with long pepper,‚Äù where the middle term is elided.

original: no // yang na gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya bar rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: no // yang na gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya bar rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Or, ‚Äúcapable of materiality‚Äù means ‚Äúcapable of being damaged.‚Äù

original: de ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir na gnod par bya bar nus so //üîΩde'i ngo bo ni gzugs med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mjug la khams zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di yod pa de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya bar rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir na gnod par bya bar nus so // de'i ngo bo ni gzugs med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mjug la khams zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di yod pa de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya bar rung ngo //
translated: Because it possesses materiality, it is capable of being damaged.üîΩThe formless realm is the formless realm, where the word ‚Äúrealm‚Äù is elided.

original: gang gi tshe mjug la tshig med par gzugs med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mjug la tshig med par gzugs med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor te /
translated: When the word ‚Äúrealm‚Äù is not elided, the compound ‚Äúformless‚Äù is used.

original: dper na gzugs rnams las 'das pa ni gzugs med pa dag go zhes bya ba de'i tshe ni gzugs med pa dag nyid gzugs med pa rnams so zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs rnams las 'das pa ni gzugs med pa dag go zhes bya ba de'i tshe ni gzugs med pa dag nyid gzugs med pa rnams so zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: For example, when it is said that the formless realm transcends form, then the formless realm should be understood as that which transcends form.

original: yang na gzugs med pa la mkhas pa dag ni gzugs med pa rnams so zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs med pa la mkhas pa dag ni gzugs med pa rnams so zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: Or, those who are skilled in the formless realm are the formless realm.

original: yang na 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa med par yang drug par tshig bsdu ba kho nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba ni ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa med par yang drug par tshig bsdu ba kho nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, the realm of the desire realm is established by the compound itself, without the need for the term ‚Äúendowed with‚Äù to be stated.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that realm of the desire realm?

original: gang zhig 'dod pa rnams 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa rnams 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is that which possesses desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams te gang zhig gzugs rnams 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams te gang zhig gzugs rnams 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The realms of form and the formless should be understood in the same way. The realm of the formless realm is the form realm, which is that which possesses form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams te gang zhig gzugs med pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams te gang zhig gzugs med pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The formless realm is the formless realm, that is, that which is grasped as formless.

original: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni kham du byed pas na kham mo //
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni kham du byed pas na kham mo //
translated: The desire realm is the desire realm of attachment to food and sex.

original: de nyid zas yin pas na kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: de nyid zas yin pas na kham gyi zas so //
translated: Food is that which is chewed, and it is food because it is eaten.

original: pho mo las byung ba ni 'khrig pa ste /
analyzed: pho mo las byung ba ni 'khrig pa ste /
translated: Sex is that which arises from male and female organs.

original: gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the union of two with two, and so on.

original: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dag dang ldan zhing 'brel pa'am skyed pa la ni kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dag dang ldan zhing 'brel pa'am skyed pa la ni kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The desire realm is the desire realm of attachment to food and sex, that is, it is the desire realm that is associated with or produced by food and sex.

original: 'dis 'dod par byed pas na 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'dod par byed pas na 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is desire because it causes desire.

original: ji ltar de ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar shes she na /
translated: How is that known?

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pas don de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pas don de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that meaning, the elder Shariputra recited this verse:

original: 'jig rten dag na sna tshogs gang @246b de 'dod pa min zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na sna tshogs gang @246b de 'dod pa min zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The verse says: ‚ÄúWhatever variety there is in the world, that is not desired.‚ÄùüîΩJivaka said another verse: ‚ÄúThe monk who conceptualizes the objects of desire is one who engages in desire.‚Äù

original: kun du 'tsho byed kyis tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis dge slong 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed pa 'dod pa la spyod pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gnas brtan gyi khas blangs te /
analyzed: kun du 'tsho byed kyis tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis dge slong 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed pa 'dod pa la spyod pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gnas brtan gyi khas blangs te /
translated: The elder accepted this, saying:

original: 'dod pa la spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of engagement in desire:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
translated: by body, speech, and mind.

original: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yid kyis 'dod pa la spyod pa nyid yin yang dge slong ma yin par mi 'gyur gyi 'di'i tshul khrims yongs su ma dag par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yid kyis 'dod pa la spyod pa nyid yin yang dge slong ma yin par mi 'gyur gyi 'di'i tshul khrims yongs su ma dag par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Even though one who is not free from attachment engages in desire by mind, he is not a non-monk. His morality is merely not completely pure.

original: gang zhig lus dang ngag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi bkod pa'i mtshams las 'das te /
analyzed: gang zhig lus dang ngag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi bkod pa'i mtshams las 'das te /
translated: One who transgresses the boundary of the Tathagata‚Äôs precepts by body and speech,

original: 'dod pa dag la yongs su spyod par byed pa de ni dge slong ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la yongs su spyod par byed pa de ni dge slong ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If one indulges in desires, one is not a monk.

original: de bas na des nyes pa gzhan gal te 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de bas na des nyes pa gzhan gal te 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, if you say that the various things of the world are desire, then your teacher would also be one who indulges in desire.

original: gal te khyed kyi phyogs gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs dag 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba yin na khyed kyi ston pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs mod kyi des na khyod kyi ston pa yang lus kyi yul
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi phyogs gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs dag 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba yin na khyed kyi ston pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs mod kyi des na khyod kyi ston pa yang lus kyi yul
translated: If you say that the various things of the world are desire, then you would have to accept that your teacher is free from attachment, but then your teacher would also be one who indulges in desire.

original: de dag nye bar ma spyad kyang gzugs yid du 'ong ba rnams mthong ba kho nas 'dod pa la spyod pa can du thal bar 'ong zhing 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na /
analyzed: de dag nye bar ma spyad kyang gzugs yid du 'ong ba rnams mthong ba kho nas 'dod pa la spyod pa can du thal bar 'ong zhing 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na /
translated: Even though he did not indulge in those objects, he would be one who indulges in desire simply by seeing pleasant forms. But that is unacceptable.

original: skyes bu'i kun rtog 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i kun rtog 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the desire is the conception of a person.

original: chos gang dag ces bya ba ni gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gang dag ces bya ba ni gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúAny phenomena‚Äù means ‚Äúwhatever phenomena.‚Äù

original: smras pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the negation.

original: 'di ltar khams gzhan gyi chos rnams dang / khams su ma gtogs pa dag kyang khams gzhan na kun du spyod de 'dod pa'i khams na ni khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kun du spyod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gzhan gyi chos rnams dang / khams su ma gtogs pa dag kyang khams gzhan na kun du spyod de 'dod pa'i khams na ni khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kun du spyod la /
translated: Thus, phenomena of other realms and those not included in the realms are experienced in other realms. In the desire realm, phenomena of the three realms and uncontaminated phenomena are experienced.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: In the form realm, it is similar.

original: de na 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sprul ba'i sems kun du spyod do //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs med pa na @247a * //
analyzed: de na 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sprul ba'i sems kun du spyod do // gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs med pa na @247a * //
translated: In that realm, desire realm phenomena are experienced, because the mind of emanation is experienced.

original: spyod pa rnams dang zag pa med pa dag ste /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams dang zag pa med pa dag ste /
translated: In the formless realm, formless realm phenomena and uncontaminated phenomena are experienced.

original: de lta bas na ma yin no zhes 'gog par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma yin no zhes 'gog par byed pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúno‚Äù is the negation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gang dag la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dmigs pa'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa
analyzed: gang dag la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dmigs pa'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa
translated: Those that increase attachment to the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm are, respectively, called possessing desire realm attachment, possessing form realm attachment, and possessing formless realm attachment.üîΩThose that increase attachment to the desire realm through the focal object or concomitant states are called possessing desire realm attachment.

original: yin la / gang dag la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yin la / gang dag la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those that increase attachment to the form and formless realms are called possessing form realm attachment and possessing formless realm attachment, respectively.

original: da ni 'di rta dang bres lta bu de yin te zhes bya ba ni rta dang rta'i bres ni rta dang bres so //
analyzed: da ni 'di rta dang bres lta bu de yin te zhes bya ba ni rta dang rta'i bres ni rta dang bres so //
translated: Now, this is like a horse and its tether.

original: rta dang bres dang 'dra ba ni rta dang bres lta bu'o //
analyzed: rta dang bres dang 'dra ba ni rta dang bres lta bu'o //
translated: The horse and its tether are a horse and its tether.

original: yang na 'di rta dang bres kyi yin pas na rta dang bres te rta dang bres dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di rta dang bres kyi yin pas na rta dang bres te rta dang bres dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Or, since this is like a horse and its tether, it is like a horse and its tether.

original: 'ga' zhig gis rta'i bres 'di su'i yin zhes dris na de la cig shos kyis rta 'di su'i yin pa de'i 'o zhes smras la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis rta'i bres 'di su'i yin zhes dris na de la cig shos kyis rta 'di su'i yin pa de'i 'o zhes smras la /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúWhose is this horse‚Äôs bridle?‚Äù the other replies, ‚ÄúIt is the same as whosever the horse is.‚Äù

original: yang des rta 'di su'i yin zhes dris pa dang yang cig shos des rta'i bres 'di su'i yin pa de'i 'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: yang des rta 'di su'i yin zhes dris pa dang yang cig shos des rta'i bres 'di su'i yin pa de'i 'o zhes smras na /
translated: If the first person asks, ‚ÄúWhose is this horse?‚Äù the other replies, ‚ÄúIt is the same as whosever the bridle is.‚ÄùüîΩSince neither the horse nor the bridle is established, neither is ascertained.

original: rta dang bres gnyi ga yang mi shes te ji ltar phan tshun ma grub pas gnyi ga yang yongs su mi chod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod chags dag gis kyang khams rnams sgrub pa ma yin la khams rnams kyis kyang 'dod chags dag ma yin pas
analyzed: rta dang bres gnyi ga yang mi shes te ji ltar phan tshun ma grub pas gnyi ga yang yongs su mi chod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod chags dag gis kyang khams rnams sgrub pa ma yin la khams rnams kyis kyang 'dod chags dag ma yin pas
translated: So too, here, the elements are not established by the attachments, nor are the attachments established by the elements.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus neither is established.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas bstan pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /üîΩdmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang / mi rnams dang ni lha drug dag /'dod pa'i khams yin dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas bstan pa // zhes bya ba ni / dmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang / mi rnams dang ni lha drug dag /'dod pa'i khams yin dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu //
translated: The realms of desire are taught.üîΩThe realms of desire are the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and six gods.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The hells and the continents are divided into twenty.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas bstan pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas bstan pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin no //
translated: Desire for the realms of desire is desire for the realms of desire.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gnas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gnas bstan pa ste /
translated: Desire for the realms of form and the formless is desire for the realms of form and the formless.

original: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu @247b bdun ni //
analyzed: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu @247b bdun ni //
translated: The seventeen abodes of the realm of form are the realms of form.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of form.üîΩThe four formless states are the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for the realms of desire is desire for the realms of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams yin zhes bya ba de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la /üîΩde bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams yin zhes bya ba de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Desire for the realms of form and the formless is desire for the realms of form and the formless.

original: gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
analyzed: gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
translated: The seventeen abodes of the realm of form are the realms of form.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of form.

original: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four formless states are the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for the realms of desire is desire for the realms of desire.üîΩDesire for the realms of form and the formless is desire for the realms of form and the formless.üîΩThe seventeen abodes of the realm of form are the realms of form.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of form.üîΩThe four formless states are the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for the realms of desire is desire for the realms of desire.

original: zhes bya ba de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yin no //
translated: Desire for the realms of form and the formless is desire for the realms of form and the formless.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gnas bstan pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gnas bstan pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The seventeen abodes of the realm of form are the realms of form.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of form.üîΩThe four formless states are the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for those is desire for the realms of the formless.üîΩDesire for the realms of desire is desire for the realms of desire.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i bsam gtan dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩsprul ba'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gis na de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa las 'dod chags
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i bsam gtan dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyang de dang 'dra'o // sprul ba'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gis na de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul ba'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa las 'dod chags
translated: Attachment to the absorptions and formless states is attachment to form and attachment to the formless.üîΩHow can there be attachment to desire realm objects in a mind of emanation?

original: dang bral ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin //üîΩgang gi tshe 'di 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de'i tshe ni sprul pa'i sems kun du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang bral ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin // gang gi tshe 'di 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de'i tshe ni sprul pa'i sems kun du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It is attachment to desire realm objects of those free from attachment to desire realm objects.üîΩWhen one is not free from attachment to the desire realm, a mind of emanation does not occur.

original: gang gi tshe sprul pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba de'i tshe ni de las 'dod chags mi skye na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba de'i tshe ni de las 'dod chags mi skye na /
translated: When a mind of emanation occurs, attachment to desire realm objects does not arise.

original: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa'i 'dod chags med par 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩthos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thos nas sprul ba'i sems la 'dod chags skye la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa'i 'dod chags med par 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thos nas sprul ba'i sems la 'dod chags skye la /
translated: How could it be that one who is free of attachment to the desire realm is still classified as one who engages in the desire realm?üîΩBecause attachment arises to that mind through hearing and through degeneration.

original: bdag nyid kyi sprul pa'i sems las yongs su nyams nas ni de la chags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sprul pa'i sems las yongs su nyams nas ni de la chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Attachment arises to that mind through hearing about emanation from others and through degeneration of the mind of emanation that one has oneself.üîΩWhen one hears that a certain meditator emanates an emanation of the desire realm through a mind of emanation of the desire realm, attachment arises to that emanation.

original: bsam gtan pa 'di lta bu zhig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do zhes thos nas ni de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la bdag nyid kyi rjes su dran nas kyang de la 'dod
analyzed: bsam gtan pa 'di lta bu zhig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do zhes thos nas ni de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la bdag nyid kyi rjes su dran nas kyang de la 'dod
translated: When one recalls that emanation, attachment arises.

original: chags skye'o // yang na sprul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni sprul pa yid 'phrog pa mthong nas @248a * //
analyzed: chags skye'o // yang na sprul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni sprul pa yid 'phrog pa mthong nas @248a * //
translated: Or attachment arises through the power of emanation.

original: sprul pa byed pa'i phyir sems sam sprul pa po'i sems la gang gi sprul pa 'di 'dra ba yin pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni bzang ngo snyam du 'dod chags pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa'i phyir sems sam sprul pa po'i sems la gang gi sprul pa 'di 'dra ba yin pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni bzang ngo snyam du 'dod chags pa yin no //
translated: Or else, because it creates emanations, the mind that creates emanations is attached to the mind that creates emanations, thinking, ‚ÄúThis emanation is like me, the creator of emanations.‚Äù

original: yang na sprul pa sprul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sprul pa sprul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin te /
translated: Or else, because it creates emanations means that the mind that creates emanations that are objects of the desire realm is of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i rgyu'i sems lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i rgyu'i sems lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of phenomena of the desire realm, like the mind that is the cause of a pot.

original: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa ma yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod ba'i chos kyi rgyu ma yin te //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa ma yin pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod ba'i chos kyi rgyu ma yin te //
translated: That which is not of the desire realm is not the cause of phenomena of the desire realm.

original: dper na gzugs na spyod pa'i sems lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs na spyod pa'i sems lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a mind of the form realm.

original: de lta nyid kyi phyir gzugs na spyod pas ni de gnyis mi sprul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta nyid kyi phyir gzugs na spyod pas ni de gnyis mi sprul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because of that, it is said that those of the form realm do not create those two.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyis dri dang ro de dag mi sprul zhe na dri dang ro de dag ni kham gyi zas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyis dri dang ro de dag mi sprul zhe na dri dang ro de dag ni kham gyi zas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Why don‚Äôt the minds of the form realm gods emanate those smells and tastes? Because those smells and tastes are the essence of oral food,

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams kyang de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams kyang de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and those born in the form realm are free from attachment to it.

original: gnya' shing tsam zhes bya ba ni char gyi rgyun gnya' shing gi tshad tsam ni gnya' shing tsam mo //
analyzed: gnya' shing tsam zhes bya ba ni char gyi rgyun gnya' shing gi tshad tsam ni gnya' shing tsam mo //
translated: The expression ‚Äúlike the yoke‚Äù means that the rain falls like a yoke.

original: mtshams sam par med do zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: mtshams sam par med do zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no interval‚Äù means that they are contiguous.

original: steng dang 'og ces ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thad ka kho nar gnas so zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: steng dang 'og ces ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thad ka kho nar gnas so zhes ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not said that they are above or below‚Äù means that the world systems are arranged only horizontally.

original: lnga ba'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: lnga ba'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'gro ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe fifth direction‚Äù is the realm of the gods.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug bshad pa yin no //
translated: The six gods of the desire realm have been explained.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The remaining ones are of the form and formless realms.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dres pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a confusion of destinies,

original: gal te dge ba dang nyan mongs pa can yang yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge ba dang nyan mongs pa can yang yin par gyur na /
translated: If wholesome and afflicted were both of the desire realm,

original: 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: there would be a confusion of destinies.

original: mi yang dmyal bar 'gyur ba'i las nas lhar skye bar 'gyur ba'i bar gyi las byed pas de'i phyir mi'i 'gro ba dmyal ba'i 'gro ba yang yin par 'gyur ba na lha'i 'gro ba'i bar du yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi yang dmyal bar 'gyur ba'i las nas lhar skye bar 'gyur ba'i bar gyi las byed pas de'i phyir mi'i 'gro ba dmyal ba'i 'gro ba yang yin par 'gyur ba na lha'i 'gro ba'i bar du yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If a human were to perform the karma that would become a hell being, up to the karma that would be reborn as a god, then the human destiny would be the hell destiny, up to the god destiny,

original: las de rnams 'gro ba der gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de rnams 'gro ba der gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those karmas would belong to those destinies.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pas gong ma ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang yang ldan la 'dod pa na @248b spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can 'gro ba thams cad pa dang yang ldan pas mi de nyid dmyal ba nas lha'i bar du yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pas gong ma ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang yang ldan la 'dod pa na @248b spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can 'gro ba thams cad pa dang yang ldan pas mi de nyid dmyal ba nas lha'i bar du yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One born in the desire realm possesses the afflictions of the higher realms and also possesses the afflictions of the desire realm that are active in all reincarnating beings. Therefore that person would be a hell being and also a god.

original: sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin zhes bya ba ni lus rnams las dang mthun par der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin zhes bya ba ni lus rnams las dang mthun par der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings are so called because they go to that realm in accordance with their karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bsod nams sdig 'bras nyer 'gro rnams //üîΩlas bzhin du ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bsod nams sdig 'bras nyer 'gro rnams // las bzhin du ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: Those who experience the results of merit and sin

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: go to their destination in accordance with their karma.

original: srid pa par ma'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir khungs btags pa las kyang gsungs so zhes bya bar rgyas par khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: srid pa par ma'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir khungs btags pa las kyang gsungs so zhes bya bar rgyas par khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
translated: In order to prove that they are not intermediate beings, he quotes a sutra:

original: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la rgyu ni las kyi srid pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la rgyu ni las kyi srid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey go with a cause and they go with a destination.‚Äù The cause is karmic existence.

original: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma pa ste /
translated: Beings are intermediate beings.

original: 'dis 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called beings because they go.üîΩThey are called beings because they go, since they go to the destination.

original: 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya ba yin pas na 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya ba yin pas na 'gro ba'o //
translated: They are called intermediate beings because they go in the intermediate state.

original: de'i rgyu las de dag logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni las kyi srid pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni 'gro ba de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkha che ba'i yul na yod pa kha che ba rnams mdo 'don te zhes bya ba de ni mdo sil bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las de dag logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni las kyi srid pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni 'gro ba de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro // kha che ba'i yul na yod pa kha che ba rnams mdo 'don te zhes bya ba de ni mdo sil bu yin te /
translated: The reason for this is that the existence of karma is separate from those destinies.üîΩThe Kasmiri Vaibhasikas recite a sutra that states:

original: de dag kho na 'don gyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kho na 'don gyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is a sutra of miscellaneous sayings, because it is recited by the Kasmiri Vaibhasikas alone and not by others.üîΩThe term hell being is a general term for those who are similar to hell beings.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to hell beings is hell being.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to animals is animal.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to ghosts is ghost.

original: dmyal ba pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba pa dang mthun pa dag ni dmyal ba pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba pa dang mthun pa dag ni dmyal ba pa'o //
translated: The term for those who are similar to gods is god.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to humans is human.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the formless realm is formless.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the form realm is form.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the first absorption is first absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the second absorption is second absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the third absorption is third absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the fourth absorption is fourth absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the base of infinite space is base of infinite space.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the base of infinite consciousness is base of infinite consciousness.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the base of nothingness is base of nothingness.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the base of neither existence nor nonexistence is base of neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term for those who are similar to those in the summit of existence is summit of existence.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the formless realm is formless.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the form realm is form.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the first absorption is first absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the second absorption is second absorption.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dkyil 'khor ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba'i las dag yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dkyil 'khor ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba'i las dag yin no //
translated: The term for those who are similar to those in the third absorption is third absorption.üîΩThe term for those who are similar to those in the

original: skyon dang snyigs ma ni zhe sdang dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: skyon dang snyigs ma ni zhe sdang dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba dag yin no //
translated: The faults and dregs are motivated by hatred and attachment.

original: de'i phyir yang 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the realms are only unobscured-neutral states, because when the karmic maturation is established, it is counted as a hell realm.

original: 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i gzhung lan gdab par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i gzhung lan gdab par bya dgos te /
translated: The treatise passage that states, ‚ÄúAll negative tendencies increase in the realms‚Äù must be explained.

original: 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir lan brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgal te 'gro ba chos rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyi yin par gyur na de lta na phra rgyas thams @249a * //
analyzed: 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir lan brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te 'gro ba chos rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyi yin par gyur na de lta na phra rgyas thams @249a * //
translated: It must be explained that the treatise passage is contradictory.

original: cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the realms were the nature of the five types of phenomena, then all negative tendencies would increase in the realms.

original: ci ste 'gro ba dag ma bsgribs pa kho na yin par gyur na de lta na ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / kun du 'gro ba rnams zhes brjod par bya dgos te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kho na yin la de dag la yang phra rgyas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro ba dag ma bsgribs pa kho na yin par gyur na de lta na ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / kun du 'gro ba rnams zhes brjod par bya dgos te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kho na yin la de dag la yang phra rgyas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams dang /
translated: If they were unobscured, then they would be called objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation and pervasive states.

original: kun du 'gro ba rnams dmigs pa'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba rnams dmigs pa'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are unobscured neutral conditioned phenomena alone and negative tendencies to be abandoned by the path of meditation and pervasive negative tendencies increase through focusing on them or being concomitant with them, but not others.

original: des na 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore it is understood that the five types of reincarnating beings are unobscured neutral states.üîΩThere are five types of minds that link to reincarnating beings.

original: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni 'jug pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni 'jug pa dag yin te /
translated: The minds that link to reincarnating beings are minds that enter.

original: de dag sdug bsngal mthong bar spang bar byas nas //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal mthong bar spang bar byas nas //
translated: Since they are abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar rnam pa lnga yin pa'i phyir de la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar rnam pa lnga yin pa'i phyir de la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rigs pa yin no //
translated: it is reasonable to say that all negative tendencies increase in the desire realm because they are abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩJust as one says ‚Äúthe outskirts of a town,‚Äù

original: grong gi nyen gor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni grong gi g-yas g-yon yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grong gi nyen gor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni grong gi g-yas g-yon yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the outskirts of a town are the right and left sides of a town.üîΩIn the five degenerations

original: snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba snyigs ma lnga ni tshe'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma'o //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba snyigs ma lnga ni tshe'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma'o //
translated: The five degenerations are the degeneration of lifespan, the degeneration of time, the degeneration of affliction, the degeneration of view, and the degeneration of sentient beings.

original: de dag tu nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gsungs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang lta ba'i snyigs ma so sor gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag tu nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gsungs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang lta ba'i snyigs ma so sor gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is said that the degeneration of affliction and the degeneration of view are stated separately.

original: 'di gnyis so sor gsungs pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis so sor gsungs pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two are stated separately because they are from the perspective of the householder and the renunciant.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: In order to understand the cause of migration means in order to understand that the cause of migrations is karmic existence.üîΩThis also applies to intermediate existence, because it is said:

original: 'di ni srid par ma la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de lta na de srid pa bar ma yang yin 'gro ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni srid par ma la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de lta na de srid pa bar ma yang yin 'gro ba yang yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúIntermediate existence is also migration.‚Äù

original: gro bar 'gro ba zhes par bya ba'i phyir 'di tha dad du bstan pa yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gro bar 'gro ba zhes par bya ba'i phyir 'di tha dad du bstan pa yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to understand the cause of migration, it is taught separately as migration.

original: der 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni las su bsgrub @249b pa yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: der 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni las su bsgrub @249b pa yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: Migration is so called because it goes there, where is taken to be established as an object.

original: srid pa bar ma ni de lta bu yin par yang mi rung bas 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni de lta bu yin par yang mi rung bas 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: But intermediate existence is not migration because it is not suitable to be that.

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa dag kyang 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa dag kyang 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the formless realm would not be a destination,

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is born in the very place where one dies.

original: gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba dag ni gtsug lag khang ngam shing drung ngam bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa'i bar gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma bzhin du 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yongs su bor nas phyogs gzhan la rten par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba dag ni gtsug lag khang ngam shing drung ngam bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa'i bar gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma bzhin du 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur ro // de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yongs su bor nas phyogs gzhan la rten par byed pa yin te /
translated: Those who proceed to the formless realm are born in the very place where they die, whether it is a temple, the foot of a tree, or the level of the fourth absorption.üîΩTherefore, like the intermediate existence, they would not be a destination.

original: 'gro ba dag gi bar na yod pas 'gro ba'i bar ma do zhes ming don dang mthun par btags pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dag gi bar na yod pas 'gro ba'i bar ma do zhes ming don dang mthun par btags pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: If that is so,

original: bye brag tu smra bas 'o na gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas 'o na gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te //
translated: then the elder ≈öƒÅriputra would not have said,üîΩ‚ÄúThe intermediate existence is the first.

original: de'i bsam pa ni rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes rnam par smin pa'i sgra smos pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes rnam par smin pa'i sgra smos pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: The thought of the first is that since the term ‚Äúmaturation‚Äù is mentioned, the phrase ‚Äúhaving established the maturation‚Äù indicates that the nature of the reincarnating being is that of maturation.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The second says:üîΩThe reincarnating being is established as hell after the maturation is established, but it is not said that it is only the maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba yin no zhes 'gro ba rnam par gzhag gi rnam par smin pa kho na'o zhes ma bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes ma bshad do //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba yin no zhes 'gro ba rnam par gzhag gi rnam par smin pa kho na'o zhes ma bshad do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes ma bshad do // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The reincarnating being is not only the nature of maturation.

original: 'gro ba ni rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: But it is said that the reincarnating being is the nature of both maturation and nonmaturation.

original: de lta bas na 'gro ba dag ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can yang yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba dag ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can yang yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the reincarnating being is both virtuous and afflicted.

original: yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis 'o na tshe dang ldan pa de la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis 'o na tshe dang ldan pa de la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say:

original: chos de dag las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dag las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos de dag las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dag las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúapart from those phenomena‚Äù means apart from karmic maturation.

original: phung po gzhan 'gog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //üîΩde dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: phung po gzhan 'gog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro // de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not stop other aggregates‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthose that are‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThey are also derived from enhancement.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba la yag zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba la yag zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are also karmic maturation by nature.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: srog ni rnam @250a * //
analyzed: srog ni rnam @250a * //
translated: Life is karmic maturation.

original: smin bcu gnyis gnyis //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smin bcu gnyis gnyis // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Twelve are both.

original: rgyu mthun pa dag yin par ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dag yin par ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: They are not held to be natural outflow.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma nyid 'dod do //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma nyid 'dod do //
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra asserts the former position that they are only karmic maturation by nature.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / bsam gtan dang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / bsam gtan dang po pa rnams so //
translated: six gods of the realm of desire and the first absorption.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Which gods are these?

original: nyi 'og pa'i lugs kyis ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs chen dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa'i lugs kyis ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs chen dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Western India, these are the BrahmakƒÅyikas, the Brahmapurohitas and the MahƒÅbrahmans, with the exception of the Great Brahmas.

original: yang kha che'i lugs kyis ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: yang kha che'i lugs kyis ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams yin te /
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Ka≈õmƒ´r, these are the BrahmakƒÅyikas and the Brahmapurohitas, with the exception of the first born.

original: de dag gi lugs ltar na tshangs pa chen po rnams tshangs ba'i mdun na 'don pa dag kho na'i nang na gnas kyi gnas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de dag gi lugs ltar na tshangs pa chen po rnams tshangs ba'i mdun na 'don pa dag kho na'i nang na gnas kyi gnas gzhan ni med do //
translated: According to their system, the Great Brahmas are not born in the abode of the Great Brahmas, but in the midst of the Brahmapurohitas.

original: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la kha dog ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la kha dog ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of the variety of color, of marks and of figure. Color is blue, etc.

original: rtags ni gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Marks are clothing, ornaments, etc.üîΩFigure is tall, short, etc.

original: dbyibs ni srid la sogs pa'o //üîΩchu ni 'phang ngo //
analyzed: dbyibs ni srid la sogs pa'o //üîΩchu ni 'phang ngo //
translated: Height is the measure of the body.

original: zheng ni zheng gi tshad do //
analyzed: zheng ni zheng gi tshad do //
translated: The breadth of the body is its breadth.

original: dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid kyi lus ni dbyibs kyi lus so //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid kyi lus ni dbyibs kyi lus so //
translated: The body that is characterized by shape is the body of shape.

original: de ltar khyad par du byas na tshor ba la sogs pa'i lus brtsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par du byas na tshor ba la sogs pa'i lus brtsal ba yin te /
translated: When it is qualified in this way, the body of feeling and so on is sought.

original: de ni dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not characterized by shape.

original: lus ni khog pa yin no //
analyzed: lus ni khog pa yin no //
translated: The body is the trunk.

original: tshig tu brjod pa ni tshig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa ni tshig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: The expression of words is the utterance of words.

original: da ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis ni de dag gi bsam gtan dang por slar ldog pas btang na ji ltar de'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnyis ni de dag gi bsam gtan dang por slar ldog pas btang na ji ltar de'i sa pa ste /
translated: Now, in the second absorption and so on, when one returns to the first absorption from those two, how does one recollect the former abodes that belong to that level?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa ba'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa ba'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran //
translated: One recollects the former abodes that belong to the level of the second absorption.

original: re zhig bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by the mind that belongs to the level of the first absorption,

original: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not its object field.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by the mind that belongs to the level of the second absorption,

original: de ni ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has not been obtained.

original: gal te phyis thob po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyis thob po zhe na /
translated: If it is obtained later,

original: de'i phyir / 'on te thob na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'on te thob na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, if one obtains the second absorption, it is said:üîΩThe view that overvalues discipline and ritual as supreme focuses on Mahabrahma, and it is proper that it exists only on the level of the first absorption.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba tshangs pa chen po la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin par rung ba de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa thob ste spangs pas kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba tshangs pa chen po la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin par rung ba de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa thob ste spangs pas kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: If one obtains the second absorption, it is abandoned and does not occur.

original: gal te bsam @250b gtan gnyis pa'i sa pas yin no zhe na /üîΩ'og ma la dmigs pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bsam @250b gtan gnyis pa'i sa pas yin no zhe na / 'og ma la dmigs pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that it is on the level of the second absorption,üîΩit is not proper that it focuses on lower levels.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'ga' yang sa 'og ma pa la dmigs par mi 'dod do //üîΩsrid pa bar ma la gnas pa dag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma la gnas pa de dag gis tshangs pa chen po de mthong nas 'di skad du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring ba dang dus ring por gnas pa mthong
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'ga' yang sa 'og ma pa la dmigs par mi 'dod do // srid pa bar ma la gnas pa dag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma la gnas pa de dag gis tshangs pa chen po de mthong nas 'di skad du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring ba dang dus ring por gnas pa mthong
translated: Because it is not proper that any affliction focuses on lower levels.üîΩThose abiding in the intermediate existence see it

original: la zhes smra'o //
analyzed: la zhes smra'o //
translated: Those abiding in the intermediate existence see Mahabrahma and say, We see that this sentient being has a long life and endures for a long time.

original: phyogs 'di yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: This position is also untenable.

original: 'di ltar srid pa bar ma de na yang khu chu dang khrag la mi ltos pas skye ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir dus ring por gnas pa srid pa med na ji ltar de dag gi blo la bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa bar ma de na yang khu chu dang khrag la mi ltos pas skye ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir dus ring por gnas pa srid pa med na ji ltar de dag gi blo la bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing
translated: Because they do not rely on semen and blood in the intermediate existence, there is no obstruction to birth and they can remain for a long time. If they do not exist, how could they think,

original: dus ring por gnas par mthong ngo snyam du shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus ring por gnas par mthong ngo snyam du shes par 'gyur te /
translated: We see that this sentient being has a long life and remains for a long time?

original: dus ring por gnas pa shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus ring por gnas pa shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is impossible to know that they remain for a long time.

original: de lta bas na /üîΩde na gnas pa kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa la gnas pa de dag kho na tshangs ba chen po de'i sngon gyi tshul rjes su dran zhing ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na / de na gnas pa kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa la gnas pa de dag kho na tshangs ba chen po de'i sngon gyi tshul rjes su dran zhing ste /
translated: Therefore,üîΩthose abiding there alone remember the former way of life of Mahabrahma,

original: skye ba'i gnas skabs kho na na de dag gis tshangs pa chen po sngar byung ba de dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas skabs kho na na de dag gis tshangs pa chen po sngar byung ba de dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo //
translated: and they see that Mahabrahma, who arose earlier, remains for a long time.

original: mthong nas kyang phyis dus phyis de dag mthong ngo snyam du shes pa yin te blo la zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang phyis dus phyis de dag mthong ngo snyam du shes pa yin te blo la zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: and having seen them, they later know that they saw them.

original: de lta yin na sems can 'di yang sems la 'di snyam du kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam du smon la bdag cag kyang 'dir skyes pas zhes bya ba'i 'di la na ma btab par 'gyurüîΩro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na sems can 'di yang sems la 'di snyam du kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam du smon la bdag cag kyang 'dir skyes pas zhes bya ba'i 'di la na ma btab par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then this sentient being also wishes, ‚ÄúOh, that other sentient beings might be born here with me,‚Äù and we are born here.

original: sa mtshungs pa'i phyir skyes nas thob pas tshangs pa chen po de'i sems la smon pa de shes te dran par gyur pas de ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sa mtshungs pa'i phyir skyes nas thob pas tshangs pa chen po de'i sems la smon pa de shes te dran par gyur pas de ni nyes pa med do //
translated: But this is not a fault, because they are born there through the power of the prayer of the Great Brahma, who is born there through the power of the innate virtue of beings.

original: yang na de las thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de las thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because they obtain it from him.

original: 'di dge rgyas pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni lus gcig cing 'du shes tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dge rgyas pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni lus gcig cing 'du shes tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But this also applies to the gods of the Abhasvara realm, who have a single body and multiple cognitions.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di skad du de dag gi dngos gzhi'i sa la bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas nyer bsdogs las btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon du byed la zhes bshad pa rgyas par @251a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag gi dngos gzhi'i sa la bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas nyer bsdogs las btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon du byed la zhes bshad pa rgyas par @251a * //
translated: It would have to be explained in detail that they are dissatisfied with the faculty of pleasure on the actual basis of the third absorption and manifest the faculty of equanimity of access concentration.

original: brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But that is not so,

original: de dag ni 'og nas lus gcig cing 'du shes gcig pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'og nas lus gcig cing 'du shes gcig pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they will be explained below as having the same body and the same discernment.

original: bde ba des zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pas so //
analyzed: bde ba des zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby that pleasure‚Äù refers to the level of the third absorption.

original: sems g-yo bar byed pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni sems rgod par byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sems g-yo bar byed pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni sems rgod par byed pa yin pas so //
translated: It is said that ‚Äúit agitates the mind‚Äù because it causes the mind to become excited.
